text: Wow, if you're looking for a good value meal, this is the spot. $8 for a massive lamb platter is almost unheard of these days. The closest value item I can think of is the $7 Halal Guys cart platters you get in NYC - but this is much better quality imo. The lamb was very flavorful and sat on a huge pile of rice. The salads are drenched in a little too much sauce but it's still good. The real winner is easily the hummus. The same platter gives a very hearty side portion (includes naan) and it could almost be a meal alone. The paprika and olive oil on top are perfect compliments.

Really yummy place that won't break your wallet.  Two rice varieties: lentil rice and curry rice. Lentil rice was more of a carbheavy and beany variety with a little salted, super moist and well cooked! The curry rice is definitely drier, more basmati-like with a little bit of yellowing/masala type of taste.  Out of the three meat options, I'd say the chicken is the best, really tender and super flavorful. The lamb and other patty-like meat is definitely drier and chewier.  Cucumber salad is better than tabouli salad imo, and you can mix the yogurt dressing in with your rice and meat. Hummus was super creamy, minus the olive oil but spiced with cayenne pepper and whipped to a smooth texture. Quantity was huge for our dinners, only qualm is that they forgot our orders twice. Other than that, perfection!

Very disappointed. I had gotten the chicken schwarma sandwich. It fell apart within a couple of bites of the pita. And the chicken was cold and was just huge pieces dark meat that had tone of grizzle. I also ordered a small rice. And it was also underwhelming. It had no salt and was dry. They put their two salads on it (I had asked for it). Neither had a very good flavor, I ended up pushing it off to the side.  I might have had higher hopes, but it's cheap and you definitely get what you pay for. Their drink cooler was out of order, so all of the drinks were warm and I passed.  Will not be coming back.  I will stick to naf naf grill where I know it is delicious.

Finally made it back here after almost two years! Still as drool-worthy and yummy as ever!   I split the meat combo with my mom; the portions were huge and filling for the two of us. Everything was very good. I always recommend this place to my friends. Can't wait for my next visit! :)
The hummus is fresh and tasty. The portions are huge and delicious.  We enjoyed it very much.

I love going to Sultans market for middle eastern style food. The food is a very good value. The meat can sometimes be dry if you go at the wrong time but generally it is cooked right. I'll usually buy a few meals at once and then keep them in my fridge for later because it is such a good value.

I really liked the idea of grabbing some of my favorite food on the go. Unfortunately there is sometimes some compromise that comes with quick serve. I wasn't a fan of pitas out of a package (opposed to homemade). They are dried out and lack taste or texture. I had the chicken which was fine - and everything was fine considering it's quick serve. It's just not great compared to other Middle Eastern experiences I've had.
Most delicious. Chicken shawarma was excellent. Hummus was tasty and the sandwich was filled with perfect spices. Hot was not very hot so if you like flavor, the hot won't be an issue.

Looking for a cheap breakfast, lunch or dinner? THIS IS THE PLACE TO GET SOME BOMB MEDITERRANEAN FOOD! I love this place. Their falafel is perfect and fresh. The plate meals are super cheap, but give a ton of food for such a small price. It's really unbelievable on how cheap this place is for the quality and quantity of food they give. I recommend getting the lamb plate, super good.  Also, get a few falafels and a baklava. You need something a lil sweet to even out the salty. I really can't say anything more except I recommend this place very highly.  Doctors, if you are reading this, yes you at the Lurie Children's Hospital Outpatient Center, if you are on break then make sure you go eat here! I know Starbucks is across the street, but this is even cheaper than Starbucks.

I love this place. Perfect spot for cheap, filling food. I usually get the falafel pita and it's so good. I've also had the lentil soup (best I've ever tasted) and the spinach pie. The were great and I paid under $6. Unlike the North Avenue location, they accept credit card here which is convenient. Workers are pretty nice. I wouldn't recommend planning to eat in as there's limited seating.

This is my go-to Mediterranean restaurant. The chicken shawarma is my favorite dish and the hummus is the best! I love the local feel and the prices are very affordable. I recommend this for either a quick bite in or takeout!

This piece is an awesome small eatery! Stopped by after Pride a few weeks ago & although it's not a buffet, they do have an awesome cold salad bar ($6/lb). Beware of the highly limited (seating though!  I normally avoid Mediterranean food as a vegan, even though Mediterranean food is vegan-friendly because I'm tired of always having falafel. But since I'm rarely in the area & was passing by, I decided to stop in & I'm so glad I did. Their baba ganoush is out of the world! Although I've got to say that I've never had bad baba from a restaurant before. The store bought stuff is another story.  I decided to take a small container of baba home by the weight because I didn't think I needed a whole pound (small size) & it'd be cheaper. I filled it up from the salad bar & lo 'n behold, it's 1.1 lb, which means that buying a small size would've been cheaper. The nice cashier just charged me a little less.

Little brother of the place down in Wicker Park. This place only has about 3 to 4 tables. The food was decent, apart from their salad. I ordered their Mediterranean salad and for some reason it was awful. I also tried the tabouli and it was pretty dry and bland. Their hummus had some odd vinegar-like taste to it as well. Chicken was very good and so were the lentils. Unfortunately, a let down in all other departments. I wouldn't recommend. You're better off visiting their original location in Wicker Park.

Sultan's is right across the street from me, so it's my go to place when I'm in a rush. I get the falafal platter with the Jerusalem salad and yellow rice, and its so filling! I always end up asking for an extra pita, and splitting it in two meals. The restaurant is small and there is not a lot of seating, so I always just end up getting it to go.

Great place to come to get a quick bite and for cheap but great food. More than anything the people that work there are awesome. I come in a almost 3 times a week and I've gotten to know Marco and Carlos, we stop and chat for a few if there's no line and I love that about this place. The food is awesome and the customer service puts this place at a 5 stars for me.  I will continue to come back thanks guys!

Great little place! Portions are huge! Would highly recommend the lamb kefta either in a platter or a sandwich. The hummus and falafel are not to be missed either!  As well as the jersusalem salad - I could definitely eat that for my entire meal.  Note - the seating inside is pretty tight so if that's not your thing, definitely do take out.  Will 100% be back!

About as good as it gets - I have been to Sultans 10+ times and it never disappoints.  I always go with the Chicken Schwarma Sandwich and it never disappoints.  For under $6 bucks, you will not find a better deal and better Mediterranean/Middle Eastern food than at Sultans.  Go here people - you will like it.
I am Lebanese and it's very hard to find middle eastern food that I like. Sultans has what I need. I never go without getting a meat & spinach pie! It's amazing. Lebanese girl approved

Best cheap food in the city. The Lincoln Park location is a little small, but the food is great.  The last time I tried delivery and it was just as good as eating at the restaurant. The food came fast, it was still hot, and was a huge portion. Can't complain.
Soooo good!!! Great for vegans!!! Friendly staff!! fast service!!! Will be returning!!!!

This place is okay. Don't expect anything amazing -- expect something quick, decent, and filling. I always get the vegetable combo bc it's only $6 and their quality of meat seems pretty low. It comes with your choice of rice (curry with frozen peas and carrots, or lentil with onion), your choice of salad (tabbouleh and some weird one drenched in some weird dressing), and hummus and pita. I really do enjoy their tabbouleh and hummus. It's my favorite part of the meal. I have sumac at home so I stuff the pita with hummus, falafel, tabbouleh, sumac, and their tahini sauce that's on the bar. We've had their wrapped baked pastry things. I like the one with spinach. I don't know what it's called, unfortunately. Their baklava is waaay too sweet for me, but my boyfriend enjoys it (he's like a fly on sugar). The people there are friendly enough. Overall, the food is decent (3/5) but they get 4/5 because the prices are so cheap and you get enough food for two meals.

I ordered the Chicken Shawerna. The chicken was rough and hard to chew. I actually chipped a tooth from a piece of cartilage and bone in the chicken. The chicken was also cold and over cooked. It was probably sitting there a while. I won't be back.

Sultan's market is a pretty good place if you're looking for something quick, filling, and cheap. The place is pretty small (only can seat around 8 people) however you can usually find a seat because most of the orders are togo.  They have several different options from sandwiches, dinner plates, or a price per lb bar. The bar has a pretty good variety and is not that expensive so you can load up on anything you crave. I personally have only gotten the falafel dinner plate and chicken dinner plate; however both have been great. The plates come with rice, your chosen protein, salad, hummus, and pita. The plate is actually really filling since they pile the box til you wonder how it's going to close! The Tabouli salad is definitely a good choice to give a green freshness to the load of food you're going to consume. The falafels are really good at this place, so if you're vegetarian or just not in the mood for some meat you can grab a pretty filling meal here.  The baklavas are also really good at this location, I would grab one if you're having a sugar craving! The workers are always quick and mostly friendly so don't be afraid to stop by for some food.

I come here pretty much every Monday since I work in the area. I absolutely love Sultans! Not only is their food delicious and healthy, you won't find a more affordable lunch. I normally spend between 4-5 dollars here and get so much food. The staff is always extremely friendly and personable.

I'm supposed to like Sultan's Market because everyone likes it, right?  Nope.  The meat combo dinner was underwhelming, but certainly not because of the generous portions.  My chicken shawerma was tough and had two pieces of gristle in it, the pieces of lamb were a little dry, and the pita bread was bland, food service pita bread and served slightly cooler than room temperature.  The hummus--the highlight of all Middle Eastern restaurants--was soupy rather than grainy (it looks a little runny in my photo) and an unfortunate combination with the tasteless pita bread.  Maybe they had an off day, but my taste buds didn't.

Disgrace to be called as Sultan ! Lowest quality of Shawarma , I mean how can you goof up something so basic. The chicken meat was cold, no Flavors, huge chunks of meat, pita felt like frozen warmed up, no freshness in any of the ingredients and add to that this happened exactly to my friend. So it's inconsistent mediocrity, I m angry add to that staff which just nodded their heads to agree on my feedback. If the owner reads this review, plz bring back the legacy of this restaurant , plz
We regular Sultans because it's super affordable and consistently good. For a fast Food Mediterranean place, I say 5 stars. It's exactly what I want in my neighborhood.

This place is amazing. We were next door and asked where we could eat and they recommended Sultans Market. They said they have the best falafel around and they were right. The prices are unbelievably low and the portions are generous. Everything was delicious. They have one other location right now. We got an extra meal to go and some of their wonderful cucumber salad!
Delicious food and awesome customer service!! Salad bar always has fresh options. And it's so affordable!

The food is meh, but the prices are reasonable. Down this street though, there are so many good options, that you could easily decide to get something else. While choosing this restaurant would by no means be a bad decision, it won't necessarily be an amazing gastronomic journey by any means either.

Sultan's ingredients were fresh, and the combination of flavors was delicious. Not to mention that it was also very affordable and they served large portions. Could use more room for seating, but overall had a wonderful visit. Will definitely eat here again!

Have gotten delivery twice here. Food travels very well and quickly but even quicker if you're smart enough to order between peak times. Love the lamb plate. The aloe water got me under it's spell. Reheats very well and has impressed me every time in terms of price and quantity. I love Sultans!
The best Mediterranean food in Chicago! The food is very reasonably priced, portions sizes are big, the food is very fresh and healthy. The staff is always very pleasant. This place is a must-try!

Very disappointed !!! Decided to try this restaurant. Firstly they were out of most of the items and it was about an hour and half before the closing time . So we decided to try falafels which luckily they had few . They were pretty  flavourless and bland. Wont judge them yet as next visit we will try bigger meal.  But it was a deal breakker ..

This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago now. High quality food and really good price！I got a meat combo today with curry rice and lentils rice both. It serves with cucumber tomato zuccihini salad， hummus，and naan！That's a perfect balance in flavor and I have to say it's the best hummus I have had here！People are very friendly there and food is authentic！Very good experience！

According to the Roman poet Lucretius, the key to happiness is the satisfaction of modest wants. If that's true, Sultan's Market will make you very happy. It's healthy, delicious, affordable, authentic Middle Eastern fare. My favorites are the lamb and chicken shawarma, kofta, the felafel, rice, but don't forget the spinach pies and the za'atar bread. When no one is looking I also order the baklava but I will totally deny it if confronted by a friend or family member.

3 pick up orders in the past month, and each one was missing 2 items. Wtf! Food is solid, but the staff is questionable, EACH AND EVERY TIME. If they cleaned up the staff, and I mean deep-cleaned, Sultan's would be outstanding for quick, local Middle Eastern fast-food.
Great food for real cheap. Quick and easy on the run. Went with my gluten-free girl friend and there were not a ton of options for her though.

Love this place! I love to go there for lunch. But if I want to sit at the restaurant, I always have to be conscious that it is small with limited sitting. Most of the time I go in there for pick up. Their falafel and chicken sandwich is amazing. The pita sandwiches are sizable, flavorful and filling. Their hummus is delicious.  Definitely worth every penny!

I love this place. I have tried a few different items on their menus, but I usually order the falafel sandwich. I honestly think it's the best falafel I've had. The prices are great, the employees are great, and the food is great!

I love having a delicious affordable Mediterranean  spot just down the street. Most affordable Mediterranean food around! The portions are Huge! I usually get the chicken shawarma dinner with Tabouli salad and curry rice. This will last me for 3 meals. The hummus is probably the best I have ever had. A couple of times the chicken was over cooked and a little hard, but most of the time it's great. I highly recommend!

OK for the price but everything was really under-seasoned. I've been here before and the falafel was good but everything we got today (both types of rice, kofta kebab, and lamb kebab)  was bland and dry
Cheap but quality Mediterranean food and very filling. We've been here a number of times and have never been dissatisfied or disappointed.
Falafel sandwich is $4 and is filled with some of the crispiest and freshest falafel I've tasted. The spinach pies are also a must. Will always return

Was in the Lincoln Park area with some friends, and we were all hungry and looking for a place to grab some food! My friends had never tried Sultan's Market before, and I'm a huge fan of the Wicker Park location...so off we went! Although I have been to Sultan's Market many times, I had never gotten their combo dinner! So, I got the chicken schwarma dinner, and my friends got chicken and lamb as well. The combo comes with rice of your choice (I loved the lentil but my friends said the curry was a little blander that day), protein, hummus, and choice of salad (I love the tabbouleh). The portions are HUGE and phenomenal. I didn't finish my plate and I was FULL. The food is always delicious and flavorful, as expected, and also very inexpensive for the hot, fresh food that you get!  SIDE NOTE, I love that this location takes card. I wish the Wicker Park location did too.
Middle eastern/mediterranean for those times when you need a no frills QUICK fix!

Sultan's Market offers AMAZING middle eastern/ Mediterranean food for a price that cannot not not be beat. Their hummus is delicious: perfect consistency, not too much tahini, and just enough flavor to accompany a pita solo or play a side role on your schwarma stage. I've had the lamb, chicken, fish, and falafel from here, and they're all delicious. I couldn't begin to recommend one over the other. Just go try one! If you like spicy, don't forget to order your sandwich/ plate "medium" or "hot". This adds an extra sriracha-based kick to your delectable decision, and you will not regret it.  Also, everything is made so fresh and from such great ingredients, I know I'm getting the healthiest meal I can when I'm there. Finally, I love Sultan's Market because the service is spot-on: kind people, working hard, getting the job done quickly (even in major rushes/ with catering/ carry out orders to boot), and doing it all with a smile and respect. Check this place out, it will not disappoint.

Great place if you like middle eastern food and you are looking for vegan options .. I tried the spicy Falafel sandwich which was the best Falafel sandwich I've eaten.. The hummus, Jerusalem salad and curry rice were flavorful and had just the right combination of spices ... I couldn't complain about the size of the place after seeing the prices .. Better bang for the buck and a must-visit restaurant!
Every portion is filling/generous and flavorful. Service is fast and great when you're on the go.

falafel still great, I used to buy a container of hummus to take home for years now, but this year I think both locations changed their recipe because each time I would bring the hummus home the texture and taste changes.  It tastes spoiled and the texture gets bubbly.

I pride myself on growing up outside of Dearborn, MI which boasts the BEST Middle Eastern in the country so I am very picky when it comes to this type of food. Sultan's Market delivers. Although I'm not sure how authentic it is, the food is really cheap and really good. Ordered the vegetarian plate with piping hot falafel, rice, tabbouli, and cucumber salad. It came with hummus and pita, all for $7. It was super delish. BF got the chicken shawarma plate and the chicken was amaaaazing. Can't go wrong.

Absolutely loved this place due to the fresh choices at the salad bar. Other people in my party ordered entrees and everyone was happy. Dolmeh and chicken shwarma were esp amazing! I would like management to label the foods at the salad bar. Customers have to ask too many questions to figure out what's what.  Do take the baklava home :)

Loved this place. It was cute and quaint, too. Anyway, the food here is pretty darned good. I had the lamb, curry basmati rice (which was beyond), tabouli, and hummus. All of it was fantastic, fresh, and tasty. Icing on the cake: the service was prompt and polite. Candles on the cake: the total cost came to just under $9! I'll definitely be coming back here on the regular.b

This place is BOMB. I've had a couple different things here. Their falafel is always moist, large, sometimes a smidge greasy but a forgivable amount. Their hummus is smooth velvettey goodness that tastes fresh and homemade. The lamb was a little dry when I got it hence the deducted star. The chicken is so moist, tender, seasoned well and they give you a great amount! I prefer the curry rice to the rice with lentils besides on days when the rice and lentils are just brought out because they top them with caramelized onions! Yum! The jeruselum salad is also great as an accent to all of it! Fresh, spiced well... Could use a little more tomato but I'm obsessed with tomatoes! I've also had the baba ghanouj and it is equally as delicious as a cool side dish! I know the pita bread isn't homemade there because they've opened up the package in front of me. However, i need to find out what brand pita bread they use because its soft and spongey but doesnt break apart too easily when making your own sandwich! The customer service is good, it's difficult to judge that much though because I'm usually in and out so quickly. Place seems clean and well kept! Not a lot of seating but that's fine because i prefer to stuff my face embarrassingly fast alone without others judging. :) all in all, a four star. Great yummy comfort food without being unhealthy!

I noticed the 4 star + average rating and figured I'd give Sultan's Market a try. I ordered the Lamb Shawerma dinner for myself and the Chicken Shawerma sandwich for my son via GrubHub delivery on 5/10. Delivery was quick and food was packaged well...which gave them the additional star.   HOWEVER : Lamb Shawerma dinner was terrible! The pieces of lamb were TINY (about 1") and so dry/overcooked (too long under the heat lamp?) they actually crunched in your mouth. Rice and lentils were bland and the TINY triangles of pita bread were stale. The Chicken Shawerma sandwich had many little pieces of cartilage and bone in the chunks of chicken making it difficult to eat. I know the chicken is chopped with a cleaver but atleast debone it properly prior to chopping otherwise it's a serious choking hazzard. (NOT COOL when your 9 year old son is struggling to cough up a bone). Not impressed at all. It seems that prices are the main appeal in most of SM's glowing reviews. But then again, I guess you always get what you pay for.....

Am in love with this place!! So delicious/affordable/convenient. Loved the hummus (which is unusual for me) and the entire plate was demolished after I was finished-so tasty!! Oh and make sure you pick up some baklava at the register, you won't regret it!
HUGE PORTIONS!! for such cheap prices. The hummus is AMAZING! All the meat has amazing flavor as well. Not a fan of their salads, too watery. Rice is good.

I had the rice platter dish with tilapia and it was quite a meal.  Got one big piece of filet along with a huge serving of rice and hummus.  I also ordered a falafel for 50 cents.  The fish was okay but that falafel was the best I tasted.  It's even better than the falafels I had in NY.  Gotta go back for the falafel sandwich now.

first of all it is my aim to visit every middle eastern restaurant in the city and have a fantastic meal by the end of the year...good thing that I have been to most of them already.  very good prices you will find here . Is it halal or not halal? its not for me to judge The schwarma is out of this world and always fresh. Grape leaves are out of this world and if you have friends who are misguided and are vegans there is also some vegan friendly options. The difference between a fresh jerusalem salad and a non fresh Jerusalem Salad is taste. Luckily for us here its fresh. Although this was never in question having been to the other one in buck town where all the people who are so hipper than me hang out. Will be back. Good options here

I grab food from here at least once a week and must say that the service is always very friendly and they're super flexible in substituting sides to accommodate their customers.  The salad bar is definitely a highlight of the establishment for me; the cauliflowers, artichokes, mushrooms, they are always delicious.

Easily one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  Cheap, delicious, authentic food that comes in large portions.  What more could you ask for?  Their hummus literally can't be beaten.  So stop by and soon enough you'll become addicted, like me. Still haven't tried the Lentil Soup, salad bar, or Baklava though.  Perhaps one day I'll be pulled away from the Chicken Schwarma dinner.
Superb carry-out joint. The lamb shawarma sandwich is unbeatable for the price. So pleased to have this just a walk down the road.

I've had falafel and hummus from many places, and their falafel sandwich is one of the very best. I always ask for extra hummus, and the balance of ingredients is perfect, between the falafel, hummus, and Jerusalem salad. The portion size is pretty big, so for someone with a smaller appetite, as I have, I eat twice from one sandwich. Also, the price is amazing for what you get, in regards to the size and quality. Four bucks and a little change is such a great deal, especially for Lincoln Park. Keep up the good work!

4.5 stars. Cheap, Fast, Easy, delicious. For $4 you can get a loaded schwarma or falafel sandwich, or for $7 you can get a dinner plate with rice, hummus, your choice of salad, and your choice of meat that will fill you up and leave leftovers(if you're a small eater this'll be two meals easy). It's a small place but the guy behind the counter and the girl behind the cash register are super nice and helpful, and the food is usually great(though very rarely the schwarma may be a little dry, which docks half a star).
DELICIOUS middle eastern food that hits the spot when you're hungry... Good prices too!
For the price it's certainly 5 star. I love food here. You really get a great value. Ive been going to this place for few years.

Delicious food and very cheap too. I ordered the spicy falafel sandwich and chx shwarma dinner and it was delivered right to my apartment in 30 min, all for only $13, including the delivery. I just got home from a trip to the middle east and needed a quick Mediterranean fix. This hit the spot! I'll definitely be ordering from here again!

Good, clean and cheap (we thought they had made a mistake $ the first time we went there).  I love the falafel sandwich and the staff is always so nice. You can choose from spicy to mild. The salad bar is great and don't forget the baklavas...mmm. yum. This is a place where you can b a regular and feel always welcome.
Outstanding food for a regular lunch spot. I order the falafel pitas consistently because of my love of the knife-skill show the chef puts on.

Cheap, quick, delicious, fresh, relatively healthy and filling.  Big dinner plate for $8 and it lasts for two meals.  Took my parents here (they're from the middle east) and they wanted to go back the following  week.  I like the meatpies to start, and the shawarma platters.  Hummus, baba ganouj, jerusalem salads all on point.

Overall: THE best spot for cheap, easy, and delicious Mediterranean. Will definitely be back! The good: Super cheap, but big portions. Nothing over like $8, but the sandwiches are under $5 and are huge. Delicious food, from the hummus to the Jerusalem salad to the spicy sauce. My chicken shawarma sandwich was awesome. Very friendly service. They even hooked us up with free "leftover" dessert pastries from the cafe next door that were going to be thrown out at the end of the night. And they were good! The bad: Small seating space if you're going to eat there, especially with 3+ people. Atmosphere: 8/10 Service: 10/10 Food: 9/10

Such a great place. The food is surprisingly cheap ($3.75 for a big falafel sandwich). Lamb shawarma is hard to find, but this place has it too. The food is excellent and they don't skimp on portions. If you're interested, there's a big salad bar on the right that always looks good as well. Seating is small and crammed, so I recommend taking out.

Huggge fan of their spicy falafel sandwich! Very tasty and not hard on the wallet, particularly for the area. The lentil rice is very good as well. The lentil soup, however, is not my favorite. The seating is limited and not good for large groups. There is also a salad bar that I've never seen anyone use...

Don't expect super authentic if you're used to eating real Lebanese/middle Eastern food. This place is great for something quick and good. Falafel sandwich was great, their sauces are excellent. The salad bar is awesome but too pricey. Overall, would recommend as there aren't many options in the area.

I love love Sultan's. The food is always good. However I wish the would work out some operational kinks. For instance, the website says they open at 10am but when I called I was told that the don't have food in the store until 1030 and no drivers until 11-- which was no where on the website. Although the hostess on the phone was very polite, I think that is something that should be addressed.

I was excited to try this place after reading the reviews but was sorely disappointed. The chicken shawarma had too saucy. I've never seen shawarma due this way before. The bottom of the pita was filled with a dark brown sauce and was super salty. Also, I wasn't a fan of the chicken - there was a couple of times where I had to spit out pieces due to the cartilage still attached to the meat. I know some people don't mind eating cartilage but I find it disgusting.

I came here spontaneously in the morning to pick up food for lunch. The gentleman at the register was so very kind and when I asked for recommendations on the dinner plates, he said the chicken was the most popular. I was craving lamb so I did half chicken and half lamb and he also did half/half on the two different rice they had. This dinner came with a side of hummus, tabouli salad, and two pita breads.  Came home to realize that the PORTIONS WERE HUGE! So glad that the gentleman recommended the chicken because it was much much better than the lamb--the lamb was really dry. Both rice dishes were on point. The hummus and tabouli was good but nothing too special. Definitely get the hot sauce!  Great service, fresh and filling food. Thumbs up!
Food was slightly overcooked. The food was cheap, though, so I would consider going back.

The service is good and the salad bar looks amazing. However my chicken shawarma sandwich was really cold. We also got the cheese and egg bread and that was also served cold... Not sure how I felt about it. The falafel was delicious though.

Alright here we go.  Every review is a math problem.  You start with 5 stars and i begin to remove stars based on poor craftmanship or incompetence. For the positives.  Good fresh looking fixin bar.  Quick service.  Reasonable price ($5.25 shwarma).  And the staff is some unidentifiable race which leads me to believe they identify with the shwarma culture. So far 5/5 stars everything is as advertised. Negatives.  I ordered a shwarma which led the mexican?jewish?middle eastern?indian? Gentleman to decide that a white guy like me would prefer a chicken shwarma (i let it go both are good)  then instead of shaving my delightful meat off of the dead animal rotator thing he scooped my not as delightful meat out of a tray at the bottom.  So some of the meat was hard as a rock (not crispy like rice cereal.  But dried out and hard like when you sit on grandpas lap) -1 star.  Then when i am driving i reach into my bag for my treat and pull the wax paper out and get this: dude puts my sandwich in upsode down so half the shit falls out into the bag -1 star.  That is not acceptable.  I am already driving down pedestrian ridden clark st.  Playing clash of clans on my cell with one hand.  Steering with my knee.  Fighting off my dog with my right elbow while trying to hold my sandwich with my other leg and scoop the shit back in my pita with my third hand.  So dangerous.  If i hit anyone that blood would have been on your hands Sultans Market.  Know your customers.  We are bipedal homosapiens.  Not octopi.

I got the chicken shawarma dinner and threw a few items from the salad bar together. It came up to $13 and some change. The salad bar is $5.99/lb. Everything was great. The chicken was a little on the dry side, but not enough to keep me coming back for more.

I went to Sultan's Market with a friend a few days ago and I was pleasantly surprised by the food. A friend had recommended the place to me and I was surprised to show up and realize that it was more of a deli than a restaurant. There isn't much seating and the decor is average. However, the food is fantastic. I had the falafel sandwich, spicy, and it was very good. The falafel was crisp and nicely balanced by the soft hummus. The spice was not too overpowering. Food was very cheap, too. Mediterranean food is one of my favorite cuisines and I think I just found my new go to place.
The most amazing Mediterranean delicious meal ever! Baklava was perfect dessert after dinner mint... Great price under $10 a lot of food! Very tasty! Love the curry rice and lamb dish!

Cheap, filling, and delicious!!!  My personal favorites are the falafel sandwich (approx. $4) and the meat combo platter (approx. $8). The falafel sandwich comes in a pita stuffed with falafel, hummus, sauce, and greens. It's very filling and such a godsend for vegetarians. Back when I was a vegetarian, this was one of the few things that was cheap and left me feeling satisfied.  The combo platters are so big they can easily feed two people for lunch. I cannot remember specifics, but it come with rice, pita, hummus, trio of meats (lamb, chicken, sausage??? don't remember exactly), and a cucumber salad. The plate literally overflows with food. Everything was well seasoned and fresh. This is basically fast food done right. You won't find a pool of oil on your plate or any questionable cuts of meat.  If you are in Bucktown or Lincoln Park and need a cheap place to eat, this is definitely the go-to spot.

This is a great little gem in Lakeview/Lincoln Park neighborhood. The food price is very cheap, e.g., you can have a full plate of three kinds of meat and rice for only $8! The food taste is also good (great if you consider the price). The place itself is small, but it surely is a great takeout restaurant.

Holy shit. So I heard about this place from my best friend's brother who said it was one of the best cheap eats in Chicago. The DIY theme is great. Literally paid less than $4 for a filling salad and a side of pita bread. A MUST GO FOR FOOD IF YOURE ON A BUDGET***

I ended up visiting this wonderful gem at lunch today. I ended up getting the vegetarian combo it was just absolutely delicious. There was nothing about this meal that I did not enjoy and I even ended up taking my leftovers to go for dinner. I will definitely be back here again!

Great, authentic food for a very cheap price! The $2 meat pies, spinach pies, zatter bread and more are delicious and only $2. The salad bar is also totally worth it, priced at $5.99/lb. The meal plates come w your choice of meat, authentic and delicious rice, hummus and your choice of salad. The hummus tastes fresh, but nothing too special.  I tried the kebab, but my meat was a bit overcooked. Still! Great value for an even better price!
This place is awesome, and quality and taste of food is consistent which is important. Not a 5 star because the service sometimes is a bit off.  We have been huge fans since 2011, however.
yum. and fast, convenient, and cheap. i only wish they'd bake more egg and cheese pies!
Delivery arrived a half hour late, lamb was extremely dry, and our order was wrong. Will not eat here again.
The place could be cleaner, but the food is cheap, flavorful and filling. I stop in once a twice a week on my way to class, love the falafel

Holy Mediterranean food!! This location is very small, but has a small salad bar and a few tables at the front. The food is fabulous! And you're talking to someone who usually makes her own hummus, tabouli, tzatziki, falafel, etc. I had the falafel sandwich: pita bread filled with hummus, lettuce, cucumber salad, and crunchy falafel. I also ordered a small side of rice with lentils topped with tabouli.  First off, the hummus is so creamy and mild. I usually like mine with loads of garlic and lemon, but this was a very simple hummus, creamy and nutty. It was so good, I could drink it! I got an additional side of it for 50 cents! The falafel was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. It was good, but not the best I've ever had. It did kind of have a grainy texture that I didn't like.  The rice with lentils were also really good--flavorful, hearty, and the tabouli on top gave it a great fresh, green crunch!  I was stuffed half way through my food, and all of it only came to $8!! If you like chicken or lamb schwarma, lentil soup, baba ghanoush, or any other Mediterranean food, you've got to check this place out!! It's great for vegetarians! The salad bar sells by the pound, or you can grab a sandwich or dinner platter! YUM!

Delicious food at an awesome price. The falafel pita is humongous and only a couple bucks! I also go in and fill up containers with dolma, hummus and baba ganoush from the salad bar for like $2. You can't beat that!

Get take out for middle eastern flare I recommend the Baked Meat Pie, Jerusalem Salad, Kefta Kabob and the Chicken Soup. Yeah I became a slob when I walked into this place but everything was excellent!  NOTE: if you do not like small crowded areas then do not eat here. But great for take out!
Best cheap but filling food in the vicinity. Their falafel sandwich is the stuff dreams are made of.

Tonight I ordered the lamb shawerma dinner. Not bad, but not fantastic. The lamb was dry & flavorless. I will continue ordering from Sultan's, but I'll stick with the chicken. Everything else was great.

The BEST cheap eat in Chicago!  Seriously, it is delicious and SO cheap. The falafel sandwich is a perfect sized lunch and it's $3.75! There is nowhere that can beat that in the city. I go here at least once a week.  It's fresh, delicious, and fast! Oh and it's super vegetarian and vegan friendly. All the vegan options are clearly labeled.  Try the lentil soup!

This place is a gem! I got their veggie combo dinner and was very impressed with the food, the prices, and the service. If you're looking for a cheap but delicious meal with large portions, this is the place to go!
I eat here and take-out all the time! It's my go-to. I order the falafel sandwich with tabouli. They usually have fun drinks like coconut water or Thai iced tea.

We had the chicken shawarma, lamb shawarma and the baked meat pie three days ago. The lamb was very dry and the dough on the meat pie was hard and just overall disappointing! They seem to be trying to provide authentic Mediterranean food but there is nothing fresh and authentic about this chain. The prices were the only respite but he quality still needs to be average no matter what you pay.

My absolute favorite falalfel sandwich in the city.  The flavors are rich and complex, the ingredients are fresh, and the service courteous. A satiating fresh and healthy meal for the same price as a Big Mac.  Within walking distance from the Zoo as well!

Came here Monday 3/23. Ordered lamb/chix combo with Jerusalem salad and baba ghanouj. This was my only meal that day other than granola and cereal. The following night I proceeded to get the most severe case of food poisoning I have ever had. A friend ate chicken, hommus, and tabbouleh and did not suffer the same fate. It tasted good at the time, if that counts for anything.
One of the best cheap eats in the city in my opinion. $8 for the combo which is a mountain of tasty meat!

I think that Sultans use to be the best game in town for fast fresh Mediterranean food. The last few times I got the falafel sandwich falafel was cold and greasy.  I think the original sultan 's market on north ave is usually on point comparatively. Naf Naf is hard to beat with their soft pillow like pita bread and wonderful shawarma.

Everything here is incredibly fresh, generously seasoned, and far too inexpensive for the area. There are always tables available since most people get their food to-go.The staff is always friendly whether it's dead or in a rush.  The salad bar is full of really tasty options like fresh greens, fruit, and vegetables, super parsley-ey tabouli, baba ganoush, hummus, stuffed peppers and grape leaves, marinated vegetables, dressings, on and on!  I have never ordered from the menu, but from what I've seen, $4 buys you more than what you can get for $8 elsewhere.  Gem!

What a find! In town visiting and craving some good middle eastern eats, Yelp brought us to this neighborhood and ultimately Sultan's Market. I cannot believe what a bargain this is considering the amazing quality of food and quantity you get for the price. They even deliver!! Our party tried a bit of everything - the vegetarian plate, shwarma, baba ganuj, jersalem salad, zatar bread, and some flatbreads. There wasn't one disappointment on the table. Huge shout out for the baba ganuj, probably one of my favorite renditions yet. The eggplant was smoky rather than sour and even went well over the rice. Both rices were delicious and the falafel were to die for. The salad bar looked pretty stellar and you pay by the pound for what seems to be a great deal.  We brought a group of 6 here, and while the seating was super tight (aka after us there were 2 other tables for 2) we would have happily taken it to-go. I'll be back in Chi-town for a work trip next month and look forward to grabbing some grub here again.

Love love love this place.  First time I went was with my friend and her 18 month old daughter, and a lot of people know how hard it is eating with children.  The toddler loved the food, especially the rice and pitas.  We loved the hummus, the tabbouleh, everything was fantastic.  Also, Sultan's is very reasonably priced.  You can get a filling, nutritious  and flavorful meal with plenty of meat and/or vegetables for less than $10.  We even had leftovers.  I've returned to this restaurant several times and have never been disappointed.  It's casual, yet delicious.  High five.
GREAT VALUE!!  Excellent Falafel Sandwich, fresh hummus and Jerusalem salad for an unbelieveable price.  It's not easy to find a quick, fresh, cheap meal like this.  Please come to the suburbs!!

Quick, tasty and affordable. The only minor complaint I have is that when I walked in, the two workers literally just stared at me for a good second. It was awkward. I'm used to smaller restaurants greeting you or getting right to business, not just staring. Maybe they thought I was someone else or had been there before and was ready to order. Anyway, ordered the mild falafel sandwich and the worker whipped it right up in 2 minutes and it was delicious and under 4 bucks. Much better than that other place down the street, which will remain nameless, even though they pile much more stuff on their falafel sandwiches and charge more. I will definitely be back.

the food is great! highly recommend for inexpensive Mediterranean lunch/dinner. the dine-in area is small, but I've always been able to sit if I wanted. I got the chicken shawarma dinner and the meat was seasoned perfectly. lentil rice was so tasty. it came with tabouli, hummus, and pita! try it! I'm happy.

Great spot for quick, cheap, yet DELICIOUS Mediterranean food. Mostly for on-the-go eating. Small seating inside the store. It is food-stand style where the server will assemble the food in front of you.  I've only had the chicken shwarma and falafel wrap, but that's because I can't imagine ordering anything else! I've never had jerusalem salad until Sultan's Market and it was tangy - not what I was expected, but tasty. A Lincoln Park gem!

Hands down the best falafel sandwich, hummus and jerusalem salad! I can't get enough. I have also recently discovered I love their meat, spinach and egg and cheese pies!  Not only is the food fantastic, it is very reasonably priced. I am always leave feeling satisfied. The employees are fantastic, friendly and fast.  I think the only problem is that I am here way too often! :)

Came here for dinner with my gf just looking for a quick cheap bite and we were nottt disappointed. I got the lamb shwarma dinner with extra meat for 8 bucks and she got the chicken shwarma sandwich for 4.75 and a spinach pie for 2 bucks. The lamb was delicious and it comes with rice, curry or lentils and rice, I chose lentils, hummus, and a Jerusalem or tabouli salad. The food was nicely seasoned, not too heavy and just right. For the price you pay and the amount of food you get this place is definitely going to be my new go to for middle eastern food from now on. Also they have delivery for all those lazy days and they have a salad bar that didn't look that bad.

This review is after my first time trying their food. I had the chicken shawarma sandwich and the spinach pie. The spinach pie was great and the hummus in the shawarma was wonderful. I need to try more before giving it 5 stars. Greatest thing is it is CHEAP. My meal was $7 and I was very stuffed afterwards. The pies are $2 and are huge. A typical dinner platter is $7 and equally filing (my boyfriend tried that).
Great shawarma. Tabouleh was particularly good.

I really like this place. It's small inside, but so are the prices!! The food is simple and delicious with lots of choice. I had the lentil soup and falafel sandwich and the bill was less than $6!! Definitely going back to try other dishes. Staff were lovely and friendly, really welcoming.

Sultan's Market has defined my entire 6+ year Chicago experience. Wonderful service and the best falafel that I have ever had. Vegetarian options abound -- even vegan options which are clearly marked on the menu. The Grandma Zerifa lentil soup is amazing too. I wish there was more seating at this location, so I would advise against bringing a big group.

I ordered an immense amount of food from Sultan's Market for an event a few months ago, and even now I'm still drooling over their chicken shawarma. The best part of my experience, though, was the customer service. They had everything warm and ready as soon as I arrived and even helped me move it to my car a couple blocks away (I felt like such a jerk for parking so far). Everyone I met that day was incredibly sweet and helpful, making sure everything was labeled and packed tightly. It made my whole day run so much more smoothly than I had anticipated. GREAT for events!

The workers are SUPER friendly! They always make light conversation and ask how your meal is. The food is really cheap in terms of price and you get a lot! I recommend the beef and spinach pies as well as the chicken and lentil soup! Also, you can grab a chocolate which is awesome! Sometimes, it's the small things like that that make it unique and fun! The only reason I took away a star is because the place is filthy dirty. The chairs, booth, walls and tables are not in the best condition and are not clean. The wall especially is disgusting. It is better to order "to go" here!
Always fresh and tasty. my favorite is the certain. Employees nice and friendly. They make allowances, when I am broke. AND they have free candy!

Found another "good, fast & cheap" place!!  I've had such a hankering for shawarma and this place rocks!  Had to go back the very next day since I liked it so much the first time!  Tried the lamb and chicken shawarma (huge pita that they stuff with meat, hummus and Jerusalem salad priced at just under $6 and $5 respectively) as well as the falafel sandwich ($3.75).  All were awesome... so tasty and flavorful!  Also had the lentils & rice ($4 for large), which is served with either Jerusalem salad or the parsley salad (forgot the name now) on top... which was really tasty.  I could easily have just had half a sandwich and a quarter of the lentils & rice and been satiated... but it was so yummy I just had to ignore any thoughts of moderation!  ;)

Do you enjoy jumbo falafel? Do you enjoy scrumptious hummus? Do you enjoy not spending more than $5 on a meal? Look no further than Sultan's Market! This place is tasty, quick, and reasonably priced. It also feels a lot more authentic than other Mediterranean chains around Chicago. My one gripe is that there's barely any seating in the restaurant. Perhaps they could place some chairs outside during the summer months (although I wonder where they would keep the chairs when they aren't using them) Other than that, its a thumbs up for me!

I go to sultans market at least once a week. All their food is amazing. The falafel sandwich is absolutely amazing. It took me awhile to try it but now I will not get anything else. I'm not a vegetarian or anything but it's that good. Their food is kind of addicting so prepare urself
Perfect. Delicious sandwiches, fast service, cheap prices, nice people. In the gazillion choices we see in Lincoln Park, this place stands out. My favorite.
Never fails. One of my favorites in the neighborhood. Try the bread with cheese and egg!

Love, Love, Love Sultan's Market.  I reviewed back in 2010 and gave it 4 stars.. but it's truly a 5 star place.  I ate at Andie's in Andersonville last week for dinner - and to be honest the falafel and hummus at Sultan's is light years ahead. Love eating here - the cost is really affordable (cheap) the food is delicious and the staff are on top of their game. If you're in the LP... eat at Sultan's - your tummy will be happy you did.

If you are in Lincoln Park and need a cheap yet tasty lunch look no further than Sultan's.  It's incredibly small so there's no guarantee you'll get a seat, but you can get everything to go, including the buffet.  The hummus, as one would hope at a Middle Eastern restaurant, is money, as are all the wraps. Sultan's:  cheap and effective. 209/365

This is a great little neighborhood hole-in-the-wall for Mediterranean food. Growing up, my best friend was Lebanese and I often would join their family dinners to enjoy food I had never experienced before - tabbouleh, grape leaves, falafel, you name it! Everything was homemade and delicious. Nowadays, it's turned into a sort of a comfort food for me, as it takes me back to those childhood memories.  Sultan's definitely does the trick. It's quick, affordable, and tasty! I ordered the chicken shawarma dinner to go (~$7) and upon settling into the feast, was transported to my happy place. The only thing I would switch out for next time is the tabbouleh salad - it was a bit dry and not to my tastes. But I'll definitely be back to try more of their menu and maybe make some new memories :)

This place is delicious!!! My only complaint is that it is too small. BUT it is amazingly fresh food, very friendly staff and extremely reasonably priced. If you want lunch or dinner and want some fresh real falafel, definitely go here!! I want to try the chicken shawarma next.
Sultans Market is a wonderful hole in the wall that serves delicious Mediterranean food. It's my go to place for shawarma in the city! And the prices are incredibly reasonable.
Great for take out when you don't feel like cooking. Hearty portions, fresh food, great flavors, and good service. I love the salad bar and chicken shawarma.

The key to Sultan's is the amount of food you get for not a lot of money. A dinner plate that comes with rice, 2 sides and pita is 6-8 bucks. we ordered the vegetarian and the meat combos with a extra falafel and 2 extra pitas, total $15.99. When I say It was a lot of food I mean enough to do curls with and get a good work out. The curry rice and rice with lentils where both excellent, good flavor not over cooked and a BIG portion. The Falafel that comes in the veggie combo was a little dry not bad once you cover it in sauce ect but on it's own it is dry. The best falfel I ever had was at Great Falafel on Diversey unfortunately they are no longer in business, they cooked falafel to order where as Sultans pre cooks and sits them under heat lamps which drys them out. Hummus and Baba ganuj where both ok but not outstanding. The meats in the combo where a little chewy with some grizzle once again ok once you cover it in sauce but on its own not great. Its a good place and for a quick cheap meal a good call. My advice buy 2 combos  use them to do 3 sets of 15 reps between each course.

Great food, the grape leaves are always fresh and have a great taste.  The hummus is very good.  I have also enjoyed the salad bar several times.   The only downside is there have been several times we wanted to eat there and the dinning area is limited to maybe 5 couples.

Wowza, the chicken shawarma dinner, falafel, and baklava was absolutely amazing!  I had enough food for a filling dinner and enough leftovers to pack my lunch for tomorrow.  I have lived in this neighborhood for 3 years now and can't believe this gem has been so close for so long!  I will be back soon!
Sandwich came out wrong. Waitress didn't do anything but introduce herself. Manager re made sandwich. Won't come back

This has been my go to lunch place when I'm working from/home on the weekend. Incredibly cheap, healthy and delicious shawerma  rice plates and sandwiches. I'm going to miss this so much when I move away from Lincoln Park in a month.

Went here for the first time today to grab dinner to go. I had the falafel sandwich, and it was delicious! I want to go back for seconds even though the sandwich was huge. I could not believe how quickly my food was ready! I was in and out in less than 5 minutes! There employees were very friendly and polite. I would definitely recommend stopping here for a bite to eat if you are in the neighborhood.

Excellent Middle Eastern cuisine for the value. Several delicious options for vegetarians, especially with the expansive salad bar. Cosy atmosphere and friendly staff too. I'll be definitely frequenting this place.

My boyfriend and I were starving after spending a good chunk of the day at the Sheffield Music Festival and really weren't in the mood to pay ridiculous amounts of cash for ridiculously small portions of food. He suggested Sultan's and I am always down to try something new! I was not disappointed and we left with more food than I could fit into my purse. I would suggest the lamb sandwich with plenty of hot sauce and get half the tabbouleh salad and have the other salad they have as well. If you're really hungry, go for a dinner plate. It comes with your choice of meat, rice, hummus, and more, all of it super tasty. I love the atmosphere here too, total hole in the wall but there's always a line and the workers are always kind. I want to come back here and try the falafel sandwich!

Awesome little shop!  Ordered the baked spinach pie, chicken shawarma, and some hummus for later.  Was not disappointed with any of it, however if you are looking to dine in then good luck finding a table.

After strolling up and down Clark St. this past weekend, my lady and I finally settled down at this little restaurant nook. If you want fresh lamb, chicken, falafel, or even hummus and rice, this is the spot. We each ordered a dinner plate (Great Presentation!) that came with a plentiful amount of food that I surprisingly fit until my stomach, while my lady took home a small box. We were completely satisfied and will be back 100%.

Tasty falafels and cheap! Hummus is fresh and options to make the falafel spicy or add in tomatoes or onions.  The workers are all friendly as well. Love coming back here even after moving out of the area.

My girlfriends and I went to Sultan's Market for lunch today.  It was excellent!  Between us we had:  Falafel Sandwich, Lentil Soup, Meat Combo Dinner.  The amount of food you get is great for the price.  Everything we had was tasty and authentic.  We talked to the guy serving us and he mentioned the recipes were from his grandmother.   We can truly taste the authenticity.   We will definitely be back.  Loved the food!
Tiny and great!  Baked Spinach Pie, falafel, shawerma, kebab, baba ganuj, kefka. Egg and cheese, salad bar, soups

Do NOT order from here.  1 hour after placing our delivery over the phone, they called to tell us they were cancelling the order because they shouldn't have taken it in the first place that late in the evening (8pm) and that they ran out of food! We obviously were shocked and told them they should have told us right away when we initially ordered or within a few minutes after ordering.  After calling back to speak to a manager, they hung up on us.  They did not care at all that they waited a whole hour to realize that they either didn't want to or couldn't fulfill the order.  Horrible customer service and management of what were regular customers who will no longer be coming back here.

OMG IS THIS REAL LIFE?!?!?! This place is so amazing. The price. The portions. THE TASTE IS INCREDIBLE. Get a chicken or lamb shawarma dinner with the Jerusalem salad and prepare to enter the afterlife.

Sultan's Market: I love you.  Whenever I am craving a falafel this is my go to place. You get a large falafel sandwich with hummus, cucumber salad, and giant chopped up falafels. Oh and get the spicy sauce. You have to. It was hard for me to deter from my beloved sandwich but after suggestions from many other people I ventured out and got their chicken shwarma dinner plate with curry rice, hummus, cucumber salad, and pita bread. Although it still didn't beat the sandwich this was damn delicious too and a ton of food for only $7. Recommend to anyone!

This place is a little odd. The front window has a partition that blocks the view to the outside when you're sitting at any of the tables. And the meaning of this would be? It's also incredibly tiny. I would suggest take out.  Here's what I liked: reasonable prices good tabuli   good hummus good chicken shawarma Here's what I didn't like dry kefta bone dry lamb shawarma the blocked out view to the street Here's what I would like to try the salad bar zatter bread The only thing that really stood out to me was the chicken shawarma.

Did not really leave an impression on me.  Middle eastern food is hard to come across in Lincoln Park, especially on Clark Street.  I guess it's nice for convenience if you live in the area, but the North Ave Red Line is not too far away either.

As many others have noted the most outstanding feature of this place i its affordability. The prices are low to begin with, but the portions that go with them make this place seem almost criminal.  And that's to say nothing of the food which is also excellent. Not that there's too many places with bad hummus, but Sultan's has a particularly nice serving since they add fresh oil and spices once you order. Every other dish I've had (everything on the vegetarian combo, the lamb schwarma) is also excellent, save for the baba ganoush, which wasn't bad but just has an usual flavor for that dish that I'm not accustomed to. I've only lived in the neighborhood a short time but this place has quickly become one of my go to stops for a quick meal. Speedy, tasty and cheap - can't ask for much more than that!
Excellent falafel! Probably the best I've had in the city. The flavors are spot on.  The hummus is great too. Staff is super nice and quick.  Wish there was one in the loop for lunch.
Sultan's is awesome, they forgot to deliver a chicken shawarma sandwich and they came back and delivered it + baklava on the house and a note apologizing for any inconvenience. I loveee Sultan's

I've since tried sultan's many more times, as well as a lot more on their menu including their lentils and rice and I'm revisiting my review. I do think it depends on who makes your sandwich, but their flavors are spot on. Obviously very vegan friendly, and one of their owners is vegan so they have some fun vegan desserts at the wicker park location as well.

I don't know why people love to eat at places with food that has been sitting in cold metal trays all day. This place reminds me of Chipotle where everything is premade and nothing is hot. It's luke warm and mediocre in taste. Quality is good, but it would have tasted a little better if the meats were tossed on the cooktop for a few seconds to warm it up. Price is ok but not worth what you get. Portion sizes are good, but if you want really good Mediterranean food, go North to Pita Inn. Slightly better prices and way better food.

The food is unbelievable-  It's fresh, delicious, and cheap. This place is a great day-to-day staple for when you do't feel like cooking. The portions are filling too. I've eaten most of the items on their menu - the felafel, lentil soup, salad, chicken shawarma, spinach pie - all favourites. The salad bar is worth attacking too- fresh veggies, cheeses and spicy sauces are a great combination. I had the pleasure of tasting the baklava yesterday. One more reason to come back!

Love the food here... although, went this saturday and was really disappointed because of how unsanitary it was.  We got the last two falafel that were totally charred... The guy behind the counter cut them up on the counter and then scrapped them, and everything else on the counter onto the plate... Was not clean.  He also used a knife that was used to cut the meat in back... he wiped it off on his apron... this is a food service night mare... he should be more considerate...ESPECIALLY IF WE WERE WATCHING... sucks because I love the food here and have never had an issue before, hopefully it was just a fluke...but that guys been working there for years...possibly doing that over and over!

Quick service and friendly, great vegetarian options! My employer has used them many times for catering. I got the vegetarian combination only $6, and the baked spinach pie for $2, there was lots of food in the combination so the left overs are for lunch tomorrow!

It hurts to write this review. If we're talking strictly the food and customer service, these guys easily get 5 stars. Why 3 stars? Their delivery is a massive disappointment.  In the warmer weather, I'll just walk to this location and the food is on point...every time. Since the weather has gotten colder, I've preferred to order delivery. I had to double check the receipt to make sure that the food was from Sultan's. On separate occasions I've ordered the kefta and the falafel. Dry and flavorless on both counts. Nowhere near the quality that I get in the store. If I were introducing middle eastern food to a person who had never had it, they would never have it again after eating this.  Another thing I found strange was that my first order arrived in ridiculous time, something like 15-20 minutes. Today my order took 2 hours. Purposely ordered at off-peak times on both occasions.  Again, these guys have great food in store and the customer service is definitely good. However, the discrepancy in food quality between in-store and delivery is truly baffling. I hope these guys can improve in this area, or else I guess I'll have to wait to eat here until summer.

I really do like Sultans but, for my past 3 deliveries or so, my order has been SCREWED UP!!! Ask for rice and lentils and they always without fail give me curry rice!! I don't eat meat (land animals rather) and I even got chicken in my falafel sandwich once. They should rethink whoever takes delivery orders.

I'm usually not a huge fan of falafel, but with the falafel sandwich under $4, I decided to try it, and boy am I glad I did! It was filling, and both the hummus and falafel were delish. Definitely one of my new neighborhood favorites.

I've been to Sultan's Market several times and, although I would still come back if I was in the neighborhood and hungry, I have always been a bit underwhelmed by the food.  The schwarma was acceptable but rather unexceptional, the hummus had more tahini in it than I would have liked, and the Israeli salad was just plain bad. It was tasteless and oddly creamy - not at all what I associate with an Israeli salad. That said, the spinach pie was quite good, I would definitely come back for that again!  I've heard that Sultan's makes a mean falafel, so next time I'll be sure to give that a try and update my review!

You don't change up a good thing, and Sultan's knows this. Aside from a smaller venue, this place has the same delicious menu as the Wicker Park location, plus they take credit cards.  On my most recent visit  I had the lamb dinner and a cup of lentil soup - ordered it when it was raining and I needed to grab something to eat on the way home. Whole transaction took about 5 minutes. Staff is super friendly. Of course I'll be back.

Yeah, this place is amazing. The shawarma is phenomenal -- spicy, succulent, and savory. Fresh, crisp salad toppings. This place brings me back time after time after time. It's near perfect street food. Kudos.

OBSESSED! I absolutely love SM - the food is always so fresh and flavorful, and the prices will make you take a double take. I usually get some falafel with a salad and some baba ganoush and its a delicious and light lunch. The falafels are MASSIVE here and seasoned so well. It feels like licking the floor in heaven, that's all.

I was really excited about this place at first, given there are no Marakesh's in Lincoln Park where I could sell my spirit beads and when I showed up to this establishment it wasn't a market at all but a restaurant.  I sulkingly ordered the triple combo meat dinner and gorged my sorrow and horniness away on it, which did just the trick in suppressing my emotions.  I'd recommend this place again, but don't go for the chicken as it's pretty dry and I'd recommend against the Jerusalem Salad (on political grounds).

I love Sultans, but every time I have them deliver food, it takes 2 hours and shows up cold. Last night I decided to give it one more try. It took 2 hours. I called to see what was up and they said, "Sorry man, we'll give you something extra to make up for it". The food arrived, nothing "extra" was there and the food was ice cold.  Sultans, if you'd like to win me back, I'm open to offers. For now, I'll be dining at Chickpea on Chicago Ave.

Its a quick lunch hour-grab something kind of place with decent portion sizes and friendly staff and what I ordered: rice and kebab turned out to be pretty decent! The yellow rice was cooked well and the kebabs were soft and moist and not in the least greasy!  The service is fast and food is cheap. It was about 6$ for my lunch. Its a small place so it can get a little crowded if you are sitting in.
Sultans is a quick and easy way to get quality protein in abundance on the cheap. They don't hold out on the good stuff and serve you a bunch of carbs for a bunch of money here. It also tastes great.

I expected great things based on the Yelp reviews of Sultan's Market and have to admit that I was not impressed. While everything was really reasonably priced and you really got your money's worth, there really wasn't much flavor in anything. The curry rice was bland, falafel was a bit off, zatter bread was stale, and the cucumber salad was meh. I really only liked the meat pie. Oh well.

I love Sultan's Market! I actually hadn't been to Sultan's in almost a year (I used to be a regular) when I found myself in the neighborhood the other day and stopped in for lunch. Everything was just as good as I remembered. Good food for a good price means I'll have to make a point of stopping by more often. I love Sultan's curry rice. It is perfectly cooked and seasoned and makes a great side dish for pretty much anything else they serve. I never thought I'd be craving rice, but I can't stop thinking about it. I also like the falafel and the jerusalem salad. I usually order the vegetarian combo so I can get a little bit of everything - falafel, hummus, pita, and your choice of either jerusalem salad or tabouli and a choice of either lentil rice or curry rice. It is a lot of food for not a lot of money.

STAY AWAY FROM SULTANS if you are looking for Authentic Mediterranean/Middle Eastern food. The Kufta Kabob is cooked irregular, the Brown Rice with lentil is horrible! the "Israeli Salad" is not consumable ! The service is VERY FRIENDLY and VERY FAST!! and it is not COSTLY AT ALL! but speaking as someone who has come from the Mecca of Middle Eastern food (Metro Detroit) this is no where near Middle Eastern Food. When I asked for Garlic sauce, they pointed at the ranch!! The hummus was good but nothing to rave over! Their Pita for their sandwiches is mediocre to say the least. I am sorry but I have been here twice and will not go back! NEXT!
Best falafel sandwich I've ever had. This place has become a staple of my diet.

This place is such a gem. I love that it's across the street from my apartment so that I may quench my weekly falafel cravings with ease! The staff is superb, quick and friendly. The food is just delicious(falafel sandwich and salad bar, FTW!), and to top it off, it is very affordable.  If you like to pick at the salad bar like I do, fill a tin with the brussel sprouts, cauliflower, marinated mushrooms, green beens and olives. YUM NOM NOM. I love you, Sultan's Market!
it was ok, hummus not up to pita house/inn standards, so if you've had those places, stay away from here...better yet, if you're middle eastern..just cook at home
Love the freshness of all their healthy dishes. I love this place for a quick lunch or dinner bite and it's affordable.
Great food, for a very reasonable price.  I get the chicken shewerma pita every time. It's only $4.75 and is enough to fill me up.  Do yourself a favor and go there!

Where can I begin with Sultan's? My boyfriend and I have been coming here for years, both locations. The hummus is homemade and out of this world. I get either the falafel sandwich or the vegetarian combo. You gets heaps of food very inexpensively. The sandwich is a full pita stuffed with falafel, hummus, Jerusalem salad and hot paste sauce if you want (which we love!).. Their rices are a bit dry sometimes but nothing a little sauce or hummus can't fix. The guys working here are always very polite and they always deserve a tip!  This is definitely our go-to place and always will be so long as we live around the block.

Yum! The chicken schwarma was the best. We got a chicken dinner plate lamb schwarma dinner plate, a meat pie, and a falafel sandwich. The pie was filled with ground beef and it was not that good and surprisingly the lamb and falafel sandwich were a bit bland... Oh, and the kabouli salad that came with our food was delicious!! The restaurant is small but its really pretty on the inside and good enough seating. The best part about Sultan's was that their prices are very reasonable: $3.75 for a falafel sandwich... not bad!!

I went to the Peggy Notebaert Nature Museum for their "Nature On Tap" night, and stopped here for dinner.  I had a falafel sandwich, which tasted very good and was filling.  In addition, it was only $4 with tax!  I won't go out of my way to come back here, but I'll likely stop by here again if I'm in the neighborhood. 4 stars/5

I love Sultans Market-  They are extremely inconsistent with their deliveries and the chicken schwerma was even delivered without seasoning once but I was offered a free meal and I forgive ya Sultans because when you get it right- your food is amazing!

We tried this for a quick lunch.  The falafel sandwich was pre-made and the falafel itself was room tempterature.  The chicken schwarma was average (also about room temperature).  It was quick, cheap and certainly better than McDonald's fare but certainly nothing to brag about.
The falafel sandwich was spicy and fresh. Lentil soup was also very tasty. I would recommend this place to any of my friends looking for a good meal.

Cannot go wrong with this spot. Their ingredients are truly fresh and the staff, although very diverse, they are incredibly friendly. Prices are great. I miss having to be in this area of town because I do miss them!
Regardless of what I order or what time of day I order it, it's always fresh and tasty. Sultan's rocks!

Yum!  I just needed to write an updated review even though my last one was 5 stars too.  This place consistently delivers the best Middle Eastern food in the city--and it's ridiculously fresh and affordable.  I recommend picking up some hummus to go to take home along with your meal.  The falafel can't be beat, the lentil soup is better than any lentil soup I've ever head, and the chicken and lamb shawerma make it hard to ever choose between the two.  I highly recommend this place to anyone.  It's great for a quick lunch or take out.
fresh food - like their lentil and rice bowl.

I love Sultan's Market, and I am continually sorry that I no longer live down the street from it (to the tune of 600 miles, sigh).  It's the perfect place to pop in for some cheap eats on your way home, and it is so good!  Their falafel has become my gold standard (which many other places have failed to live up to), and a falafel sandwich with hummus and veggies is about the best dinner you can get for five bucks, in my opinion...and I'm not even vegetarian. There's a few places to sit, if you're not getting to-go, and the guys at the counter are pretty decent -- when I'm dining in and it's busy, they've told me to just wait to pay until after I eat so I can avoid the crowd at the register.  Oh, Sultan's Market, I miss you!
Food is great at a good price. Very little seating though. Also if you get heartburn easily like me, bring on the tums.

I try not write reviews for places with hundreds of good ones, but I'm jumping on the bandwagon for Sultan's Market. There are a few low reviews claiming they had dry chicken or too much (insert picky comment here), but the overall rating still amounts to 4 stars... I think you can tell without reading this that the place is good. Overall: - cheap - fast - tasty - fun atmosphere, including BYOB To begin with the cheap comment, a "small" soup is $2. Sandwiches are $4-6 and combination plates are $6-7. The portions are a very good size. Yesterday, with a cold, I wanted some soup and Mama Masada's Chicken soup was what I needed. It tasted like broth that had been made with care. There were plenty of vegetables (including potato chunks?) I've had the lentil soup too, and that is also good. Yesterday I also got the vegetarian combo with falafel. At my table, I built little sandwiches of falafel, hummus, tabuli and sirachia. The combination was tasty, and after all that food I took about half of my rice with lentils home. They gave me no problem about taking a container from the salad bar for that. I've also previously had the curry rice and enjoyed that (you get to pick one of the types of rice you want in your meal). My boyfriend got the meat combination, and enjoyed it all. I tried the lamb from him, and the seasoning is kind of like that of stuffed grape leaves - which they also have!  I've never had the buffet, but that's inherently done with fast service too. The cashier was nice not only about my take home container but also bringing us waters. They are fine with BYOB, and while the sitting area isn't huge, I've never not been able to sit. It's casual overall, but if you stop and take a second, the decor is pretty cool. There are mirrored, golden tiles on the side wall and ceiling. If you sit, you might feel yourself like a Sultan. Doesn't get much better than this.

Sultan's Market fills the niche of fairly good "Lebanese/Mediterranean" food in an otherwise barren neighborhood. You've got to appreciate this place for what it is, and what it isn't trying to be.  I usually get the lamb dinner/sandwich with small heapings of Tabouli and Jerusalem salads at the "salad bar". Yes, occasionally the lamb is a little dry. And yes, the pita is not always the best. But it is quick, cheap and all so delicious 70-80% of the time. Their baklava is honestly decent. Baklava's made by Greek grandmas tend to be too sweet for me, but Sultan's has it just right. Flaky and just the right amount of sweetness. Pick up some meat and a piece of the baklava at the counter. Go home and enjoy this little shop for what it's worth.

This place is awesome. Great food with a great value. I can be a pain in a$$ when it comes to customizing menu items and these guys are not only kind enough to heed my every request but hook it up super fat too. Love the food. Love the employees. The only downside is that it is hard to eat in because there is such limited seating,

I used to live down the street from Sultan's Market and this is one of the things I miss the most: Cheap, fast, delicious falafel. I've had 100 different falafels and this is hands down, the BEST falafel in the city! Possibly/Probably the best falafel I've ever had. This is no joking matter, as I eat falafel at least once a week, so trust me :) Make sure you ask for some hot sauce and tahini as it all plays so well together! I also recommend you try the Mama Masada Chicken Soup as it's very good, balanced, warming, and made with great quality white meat chicken. For a very reasonable/cheap $2 you can get a "small" that's very generous in size as a nice side to your falafel.

I work down the street from this place, and I go here often enough to know that they can do better. Up until the last few weeks I had no complaints. When I went a week ago, the flavors seemed off, the Falafel was extra crispy, and it just didn't taste right but I figured that could just be me. Today, the person working behind the counter didn't even bother to cut up the falafel in the sandwich - he just stuffed three falafels in there and dumped a bunch of cucumber over it. The whole thing fell apart within a couple bites.

This area is hurting for quick and easy food that isn't crappy or over priced, or another byob sushi place!.  A solid falafel or shawarma and a decent salad bar offering. I would say that 6 bucks for a falafel sandwich is a bit overpriced but its lincoln park, so this is the best value you are gonna get.

Amazing. I come here all the time. Always consistent, great tasting fresh ingredients, very inexpensive and healthy food for you! Staff is always kind. Great Mediterranean food! Can't recommend it enough.

Delicious, very large falafel for $3.75 + tax. Yum! The ingredients were fresh, there were a lot of veggies and quite a bit of hummus and the falafel was moist instead of dried out (like I've had served at some places.) I plan to go back here very often.
Super delicious, super affordable, super filling, super nice staff The lamb shawarma sandwich and the falafel are my faves! Definitely a takeout place; there are only a few seats inside
