I've been here a couple times and tried a few things off the menu including the falafel sandwich and lamb sandwich.  I consider myself a frequent customer of these sort of carry-out Middle Eastern places and would rate Sultan's as definitely above-average but not stellar.  A great place for a quick eat if you're in the area or work nearby and are looking for a place to grab a quick lunch.

Basically a 4.5, I need to take off because the pita wasn't great. And pita at a place like this should be fantastic. Picked up dinner from here with Halley W. and Amy F. and we are seriously loving this neighborhood gem. There isn't a ton of seating inside, so it's probably best to carry out.  Both of my dining companions had the chicken shwarma dinner which came with rice, hummus, and a choice of salad. This was a TON of food for $7! I ended up with the small soup and the salad bar. The salad bar has plenty of fresh vegetables, salads, feta, and croutons made of seasoned pita. I got a fairly large salad for around $5.00 (they weight it and price by the pound). I'll definitely be returning to this affordable option on Clark!

I get lunch from this place all the time! The chicken shawarma sandwich is fantastic really hits the spot, perfect portion for lunch. For dinner I would go for the chicken or lamd shwarma plate. the curry rice is great, their hummus is very tasty and creamy, love it!

Got a huge array of salad bar goodies and the meat combination dinner.   Everything was great.    I also loved the juices.  We tried lychee and passion fruit and the lychee was delcious.   Both of the schwarmas were flavorful and the hummus and salads were very fresh. The stand out here is definitely the employees.   There were 2 guys running the line and register and they were so helpful and polite. As we left I was reading some of the reviews on the wall.  There was a review from 2008 that listed some of the prices.   Their prices are still the same.   Thats pretty impressive!

I must say... The best Falafel I've had in a very very long time!  As I walked in, famished but hopeful that the $5.45 falafel was good enough to suffice my appetite I bit into it! All the ingredients were absolutely fantastic! The hummus was just as I recall having it in Israel... The meats (lamb and chicken) were fresh and moist and the salad toppings went so well with everything... I must say, what a treasure to find... and the price doesn't get any better! I was so, impressed by the quality of my food that I had to go and thank the guy for recommending it and tell him it was absolutely wonderful!  I will most certainly go back there... Fantastic! Finally, the personnel was great!

FANTASTIC FOOD - awesome vegetarian dinner! the falafel and hummus are super stellar! my friend had the lamb shawarma and loved it! FANTASTIC PEOPLE - the workers were really friendly and addressed me as "miss"! FANTASTIC MUSIC - hip hip hipster music for a great vibe! go go go to this FANTASTIC place!!
This place is a hidden gem! Unreal lamb and chicken schwarma and perfect tabouli, plus they bumb good tunes while you nom. Friendly, cheap, a must eat.

What kind of fresh Hell is this? Why, after 6 years of walking past this place, did I finally cave in to a few random raves and go here for dinner?  I shoulda known by the two vegetarian hipsters frenching in the corner that this wasn't the place for me. (Yo! Lennon and Stella! Save it for your art show. I'm tryin' to eat over here.)  I went for two basics that I normally love: chicken shawarma and falafel.  Here, during peak dinner hours, the chicken shawarma was dried out to the point of being plastic-like.  That poor dehydrated clucker was smothered in a grotesque amount of hummus... likely in a vain effort to make the chicken seem somewhat edible. This may very well have been the worst thing I've been served in a restaurant all year. The falafel had been under the heat lamp way too long. Way, way, way too long. How to you F up falafel when your website is  chicagofalafel.com   I dunno. but they did and I ain't going back for an encore.

This place is close to my job & I decided to give it a shot after working in the area for a few months.  I loved it.  It was quick, delicious & inexpensive.  Sure, if you want a fancy sit down dinner there's more criteria to be met...but this isn't that kind of place.  It's casual and not fussy at all.  Proportions are good, flavors are spot on and each time I eat there I love it all over again.  More please!
Love this place! Always great food at an unbeatable price. Reminds me of how much one can love food.
Good food, great staff. I just wish it was a little more spicy. But very friendly and nice staff, healthy food. I'd recommend it. I had the lamb plate.
Awesome baklava! I had their spinach pie, it was good! I have also had their hummus, and they did not disappoint.  The staff has always been friendly.  Another plus point: OPEN LATE!

Beautiful food and the staff is awesome. They give you EXTRA food. I dont think these guys will stay in business long because they give you just so much more food than they charge and it is delicious.

I live right by this place and have tried almost everything on the menu yet to be disappointed.  My "go-to" is the spicy chicken shawerma dinner with both rices and both salads. The food is always great, the lamb and pies are worth trying too. In my opinion, the hidden gem and best item on the menu is the homemade chicken soup with a squeeze of fresh lemon. It is light and incredibly flavorful. Do not miss out on the soup because everything else is so good, you won't be disappointed. The staff is always friendly, the portions are enormous and it is cheap to boot!

For a place so prompt, I'm actually surprised by how tasty Sultan's Market's grub is. I'm pretty serious about my hummus and falafel, if I go some place that offers it, I'll order it. And if I order it and it's not good, then my mood's not so good either! :( Thankfully, that wasn't the case at Sultan's Market. I've also tried their chicken shawerma dinner, which was lovely. This place is halfway between my work and my home, so it's convenient to have such a place where I can quickly grab lunch before heading back to the office or quickly grab dinner before heading to my pajamas. Kudos, Sultan's Market, kudos!

The food is good here and the salad bar is a great value at $5.99 a pound. The hummus and baba was good and the grape leaves were pretty tasty but nothing blew me away. The salad bar is a great choice for a cheap option. One negative about this location is that it's teensy tiny, it can be hard to grab a seat here so I wouldn't plan on eating in. I think they might also have more options available at the Wicker Park location before although I've never eaten there just walked in to check it out.

Sultan's was suggested by the desk crew at a nearby hostel and a good suggestion it was for a quick, tasty and inexpensive lunch of meat pie, spinach pie, an I'm not sure what it was, and a small bowl of prepared from scratch chicken soup.  All were tasty and served by friendly staff.
great food and very nice staff. i went to buy an extra order of something, either hummus or a falafel,  and the guy gave it to me for free.

Quick. Easy. Cheap. What is "3 things that Yanyao likes when she is a hunger crab*?" After being denied Spammy goodness at Aloha Eats and shrimp taco-y goodness at Del Seoul (shakes fist at Labor Day, but not really, yay for holidays!), I realized that I needed to eat something, and it needed to be 1) good, and 2) fast. In steps Sultan's Market. I'd never been before. I have friends who are obsessed with the place. It was time. The space is TINY but utilized very well. There is a $5.99/lb salad bar set up against one wall with some pretty tasty looking grape leaves, marinated artichoke hearts, and many other veggie items. (Next time). Then, there is a cafeteria-style set up with the shawarmas, rice, salads, breads, etc. I ordered the veggie combo dinner - you can choose between rice with lentils or a curry basmati rice, and Jerusalem salad or tabbouleh. They put a healthy heap of hummus on your plate, cut up a few falafels and a pita, and you are ready to eat! Super fast. Super cheap. I was happy.  I am now a little bit obsessed with that lentil rice. I don't know what it is. Maybe the onions. Maybe because I am Asian and obsessed with rice in general. Maybe I like the addition of the lentils. Anyway, this rice is awesome. The falafels were crispy and flavorful. I also tried a bite of J's spinach pie and chicken shawarma sandwich - both super delicious. His lentil soup was so-so - good, but other places (ahem, Taste of Lebanon) do it better. I've only been there once but I think I'm going to make the chicken shawarma dinner, lentil rice, Jerusalem salad, my standard order.  Friendly staff. A selection of La Croix, Asian drinks, and Ting (!!) in the cooler. If I lived in the neighborhood, I would probably come here 3 times a week. RICE WITH LENTILS! *Hunger crab = a nicer way of saying I am being a crabby a**hole due to excessive hunger

I really love Sultan's Market and I've only been twice! I went about a year ago and got the falafel sandwich, it was amazing! The hummus and veggies were perfect in the sandwich and the falafels were moist (awkward word...) and cooked perfectly. I didn't go back afterwards because I later found out I am gluten intolerant. I knew they had a salad bar but just never thought to go. A couple evening's ago I went in to check out the salad bar and was amazed! There was a great selection and I came out with a healthy and delicious salad - some highlights were the shrimp, sundried tomatoes and greek yogurt dressing. I'll be going back!

I worked at the starbucks right next door for a while, and I went here almost every day for lunch. Even now that I live on the other side of Chicago, I will still trek back for some of the schwarma. Only bad thing? I'm extremely allergic to tahini (so why eat at a middle eastern place?) so I always order my shwarma with nothing on it, and just the meat. No problem. One time I called it in, came to pick it up, started eating it... filled with baba ghanouj and hummus and jereselum salad (all tasty, but all with tahini) and I had a really bad time on my hands. I had to throw it away and spend the rest of the day being violently ill at home. I still go back, though. I'm just more careful.

Chicken Shwarma was very good.  I got mine spicy.  Was the perfect amount of spice for me.  Zataar Bread not as good.  Too dry and needs to be fresher maybe.  Would definitely suggest this place for a quick, affordable meal.

Delicious, cheap, local/small business... what's not to like?!?!? It's a great place to grab a fast lunch or dinner. The Lincoln Park location is very small with no outdoor seating, but most people pick up and go or eat quickly, so I've never had a problem getting a table. They also sell some cool middle eastern packaged goods, like halva, that I don't see elsewhere. Love this place and will continue to go often!

Not only is the food great, the employees are awesome. I took out a delicious meal and left my wallet behind. When I realized hours later, I called and a super nice guy named Eric let me know they had it. He went out of his way to meet my husband to return it! If you want fantastic food served by honest staff, go here. I'm a customer for life!

The falafel sandwich is amazing. The location is small, but I usually get mine to go.  Staff is great. Soup is good. Inexpensive. I need to try more from the menu, but I really love that falafel sandwich. -- Upon further examination, best falafel in town!
The chicken shawerma and falafel sandwich are great!  Hummus is delicious too. Although the place seems to have a slight funky smell to it.

I eat here all the time.  For 7 bucks, I can get dinner and enough leftovers for lunch the next day too.  Personal favorites: the salad bar, the spinach pie, the chicken or lamb dinner.  The hummus is also really good, especially when they throw a little oil and seasoning on it. Super fast, and never a wait!  Also open late!  Rhyme!

My favorite place in LP for a quick, quality, inexpensive and delicious meal.  Almost always get the Falafel sandwich but everything on the menu is great.  The spinach and meat pies are always a good choice and the egg n cheese bread is unreal also be sure to try the shawarma.  I also really enjoy how they have a fresh salad bar and some market items like XL Sriracha bottles for me to use at home.

The only complaint I have about this place is it's small dining area. Unlike the Wicker park location, it barely gives you elbow room. But the food... Best falafel I had in the city. The food is delicious, and is not overly oily, or seasoned. Staff is great, too :)

Most bang for your buck in Lincoln Park in my opinion. Everything I have tried has been fresh and delicious. If your still hungry after eating one of their dinners you might be a professional eater. Only downside is not a lot of seating inside. Would recommend for anyone to give it a shot!

Absolutely the best hummus I've ever had in my life. And I've tried a lot of hummus! I stopped by here twice while visiting Chicago, based on its amazing reviews on Yelp. It's a small place, with limited seating, but really pleasant. The staff are friendly and wonderful. They have an amazing salad bar, and a good-sized menu of many items, many of which are vegetarian and vegan friendly.  The first day I ordered the egg and cheese sandwich, which came to $3 plus tax. WOW. It was amazing! The hummus was creamy and just perfect, and the bread and egg were to die for. Just great.  The second day I had the infamous falafel, and yes, it is huge. It took me quite a while to finish off! Once again, everything tasted wonderful, and was cheap (I think around $4).  Overall, amazing, cheap, flavourful flood. Can eat in or take out, and see their menu online to make your choices before arriving.

Very cute little place; kind of amazing how much they've packed into such a tiny space.  We ordered two dinners--the chicken shawerma and kefta kabob. Both were delicious as was the hummus, curry rice, and Jerusalem salad that accompanied both. My only complaint is that the chicken was incredibly dry--shame since it tasted great otherwise. As for the kefta kabob, the online menu says these are made from lamb, but if you're like me and really don't care for that meat, trust me when I say these didn't taste like it at all.  Tasty and inexpensive; I'd definitely go back if I was craving that kind of food while in this area.

I really wanted Mediterranean food yesterday, and this definitely hit the spot.  I got the chicken shawarma with curry rice, and once I got my plate, I pretty much buried myself in it. I love that the meal is big and hearty, and it even comes with pita and hummus, while still being under $10, which is crazy town. In a world of Pita Inns, this is a small-scale welcome change to my expectations. I wasn't blown away by the pita they had to offer, but shucks, at $7 for a meal like this, I don't really care. There were two guys on staff who were really friendly and helpful, so there's nothing lost on service. Sultan's only loses a star from me for the tiny space, since I'm sure it's a nightmare at peak hours.  I actually can't wait to come back.

Best medeteranian in. LP area for the quality and value. Delicious swarma sandwiches and a fresh stocked salad bar! Lental soup is killer! If you are looking for a inexpensive good food feeling go to place for two or three times a week this is where you go!
$3.75 for a falafel sandwich.  The most delish baklava.  Filling and delightful meal for less than $6 in the city?  Ummmmmmm yeah!

Cheap.  Fast.  Kind of delicious!   I had spent the morning trying to entertain my kids while waiting for their check ups at Children's Memorial and by the time I met my husband outside I was starved and slightly insane.  Thought I would be stuck grabbing drive through food but when I turned aroundI saw Sultan's Market and decided to give them a try.  So glad I did!  The $2 spinach pies and meat pies were so freakin fresh and tasty.  I normally don't like the dough pies as much but these were so melt in your mouth good.  Also tried the Meat Combo and while the lamb was super dry the chicken and kefta were really good.  I loved the curry rice and hummus. The tabuli was basically parsley leaves so I would not suggest that. Great meal and hungry as I was there was enough to share with my husband and kids and still have some rice and bread left over for later. Yum!
Awesome "Spicy" chicken shwarma sandwich. Can't imagine getting it delivery though, needed to be eaten right there! Super juicy. I notice mostly of the negative reviews are delivery.

Sultan's is a solid spot for a good, quick and cheap Middle Eastern food.  The restaurant is small so if you go during normal lunch hours it might be difficult to get a seat.  I had the falafel sandwich and was a little annoyed when the guy serving me slopped mine together in a quicker and different way than my friends because he noticed 4 customers walk up behind me.  The food should be prepared the same every time its served no matter how long the line is.  The sandwich was tasty though, not exceptional.  Prices are very reasonable.

This is one of the Mid-Eastern places to go in the Lincoln Park area. The food is always great, especially their selection of meaty dishes (their shawarama is delicious). The prices are great too.  In sum, best of both Mid-Eastern food worlds: delicious and cheap.

I always find these smaller inexpensive places difficult to rate.  I feel like they should break it into two different systems, high dinning and good eats.  Sultans is good eats and cheap.  You're not taking a first date to this place unless your a poor college kid or a hipster cruising there on your single gear.   Ambiance aside.... food is rock solid and two can eat here for $20.  Good hummus, wanted to try the babba but they were out.  Beef and chicken swarma was tasty and abundant.  One area that needs help is their pita's.  not much better than buying one at Trader Joes.... at least do me one favor and warm them.  That's my only complaint as the food was very good, large portion, very affordable, and again in my hood so I can walk there.  Not sure on the BYOB... they do not push it and I haven't asked as of yet... I assume yes?
Great Place!  I go here all the time and it never disappoints.  Go for the lamb dinner.  Friendly staff too.

Very impressed with this little place.  If your a fan of mediteranean, vegetarian, or falafel I cannot imagine how you could possibly not like this place. I had a great lentil and tabouli salad for $3. I also had the salad bar which had tons of options. Pros: * Salad bar freshness and variety * Cheap * Hot options were well seasoned and freshly made * Good drink selection * Great for take out * Speed of service Cons: * Small * Limited indoor seating available * Restroom was behind food counter

I rubbed a magic lamp once. A genie actually came out, no wishes, but he WAS eating Sultan's Market. It was a weird day, so I bathed in their race shortly after. Huh? Before I got to a friends house in LP, I placed an order to go and had him go pick it up. We split the Spinach Pie, Hummus, Falafael,Jerusalem salad, both rices (lentil and curry), Lamb and Chickekn Schwarma, Kefta Kabab, and even an order of baclava. Damn, lot of food in hindsight. Everything was good. Legit, everything. The spinach pie could be good on any occasion, even the day after. Their hummus was very flavorful and had just the right amount of oil to keep it from being paste-like. Their falafel is fried perfectly, buts still fluffy on the inside. The meats were all nicely charred, with touches of herbs and spices on the outsdie, and some how still juicy after traveling.  The baclava was too good. I ordered just for the hell of it, but then found myself doing baclava math. I had to make sure I got more than one triangle! Sweet, flaky, slightly sticky, with a little crunch. Yum! Can't say anything for dining in, but Iove Middle Eastern/Mediterranean food like this. Sultan's Market, is exceptional.

If I rate on food taste/quality for value, I am obliged to give Sultan's 4 stars. I received a fresh, flavorful falafel sandwich for $4!!! In addition, I had a soft, warm spinach pastry...I don't know what they did to that spinach, but it was delicious. I'll be back, very often.

I am completely baffled about the popularity of this place, yet I know people who swear by it.  Middle Easterners judge food by freshness.  You can see their point when you are buying basically simple street type food.  You will never get that at Sultan's Market because stuff is sitting on a steam tray.  I have tried the place twice and that is more than enough.  The food tastes old and tired.

My review is only for the food we received yesterday via delivery.  Meh is right. We purchased 4 of the feasts, which  provide a fairly good variety and plenty of food for 5 people. We ordered a bunch of different things and even the hummus was watery and tasteless, tabuli was bland - almost like it was just parsley and lemon, fafill was good, the beef was ok, the lamb tasted weird, rice was uninspiring -  tasted like rice-a-roni (A San Fransisco, not Chicago treat).  We were just totally unimpressed, especially since they have 4 stars.  Maybe the food is better when you go in?  Maybe we got the old stuff and they save the better stuff for people who's faces they see?  I don't know folks...there are SO many better places around.  We won't be ordering from here again...too bad.

Great menu, amazing value, and an awesome staff.  Can't go wrong.  I live down the block and have had everything the menu, and still find myself coming back all the time.  check out the salad bar too, god selection.

This is basically my new favorite restaurant. Best salad bar in history of salad bars, with marinated vegetables, pita, great dressings, and real substance.  They have 'pies' filled with meat or vegetables (like spinach pie) for $2 that are fantastic.  The usual choices from hummus to falafel all hold up to other restaurants. Eat here.

They had meat pies! I ordered a spinach pie instead though, haha. Pastry was a bit too thick around the edges for my liking, but the food tasted fresh and well made.  The Baked Egg and Cheese Fettia looked ready to be in a print ad. When I bit into it, it was hard to believe food this fresh existed in Chicago. One word to describe it: savoury.  Total Price: $2 + $3 = $5 Totally full. Next time I'm trying the chicken shwarma.

DELICIOUS falafel sandwiches for very cheap. Get it with the hot sauce, it's actually not that spicy and adds good flavour. They load it up with hummus and jerusalem salad but the sandwich doesn't fall apart like it does in other middle eastern joints. Thumbs-up for the lentil soup as well! I haven't had the shwarmas but they look excellent, also the salad bar has a really great selection!

This is a cleaner, smaller, hipper version of the Sultan's Market on North Ave in Bucktown. You cannot go wrong with the falafel sandwich, so don't be a fool and try to order something else. Good food. Friendly service. Bike parking out front.

One of my favorite places for mediterranean food.  They have delicious shwarma and falafel platters and wraps, and the prices are just right.  Many times during the winter I had their lentil soup, but often it was inconsistent whereas one time it was delicious and others just OK.

Price - best I have found in the area for shawarmas Service - quick and friendly Quality - pretty good, not the best I've had but it hits the spot Overall a great place if you are looking for a cheap quick bite to eat and something out of the ordinary...I suggest the baklava for dessert!

omg your falafels are awwweesome! hands down one of the best falafel sammies avah. I usually go to the wickie park location but was happy to find out the LP one makes them exactly the same and taste just as wonderful. They even ask me the spice level i wanted-i love that! even the way the cut the end off the round pita pocket and stick the cut off into the pita pockets so zero pita is wasted! Most places charge xtra for hummos on the falafel sammie but NOT them and they load it up and same goes for the jerusalem salad too....they put a ton of that in it as well.   Lastly i noticed something else they do differently than most spots- they chop up each of the round falafels which makes it so much easier to eat and sammy lays flatter-it just works better so they are all spread out thru it! What got me to the LP location was the scoutmob deal-where did this new deal site appear from!?? but anywhoo gets my vote esp when u offer FREE awesome falafels from one of the best spots!
GREAT FALAFEL.  Friendly service.  Fresh food prepared right in front of you.  Amazing Salad Bar. SULTAN'S might be the best place in Chicago for Falafel.

I must admit, I don't remember the last time I experienced Middle Eastern food. If I had not received a free coupon for a falalfel sandwich from Scoutmob, I wouldn't have known about this place. I went here on a Sunday and ended up just ordering just the sandwich. After the first bite, I felt immediately that it had a lot of spice to it. The flavor was very unique. The sandwich was just the right size in my opinion; although I don't know if eating it alone would constitute a meal. Regardless, it was pretty good. When I ordered, the guy behind the counter was pretty friendly. He didn't skip a beat when I asked what ingredients were in a falalfel sandwich. As he prepared it, we engaged in a nice conversation about each other's Halloween weekends.  It helps that this place is near several favorite spots of mine; so the knowledge of the neighborhood (not to mention the free places to park!) was nothing new to me. I'm willing to come back sometime in the future to try some of the other items on their menu.

We have been wanting to try Sultan's Market for a while but hadn't had a chance to make it there, we got a free falalfel sandwich thru Scoutmob so that gave us the motivation to make a special trip! :-) The falafel was to me just ok, it lacked flavor and badly need salt, hubby loved his and he also loved his babaganoush, I tried the spinach pie and that was fantastic. All in all, the prices are really good and we will definitely go back and try the shwarma!

After eating sub-mediocre shawarma this weekend at a "nice" restaurant, I had to revive my taste buds with some legit chicken shwarma.  So I did.  And it was wonderful.   Sultan's Market, you are delicious, wonderful, cheap, fast, friendly, and delicious again.

In that stretch of goodness between Fullerton and Wrightwood, Sultan's market ranks up there as my favorite.  Hands down, they have the best shawerma sandwich in the city.  I'm also a fan of their falafel as well as their lentil soup.  The price is awesome two ... you can get the sandwich, and either one of those and a coke for just under $10.  Great deal.

After deciding to try a different Middle Eastern place, I won't be back to this one. First time I went there I wasn't thrilled. Willing to give it a second chance Placed our order online and told it'd be approx 30 minutes for delivery. We were called nearly 20 minutes later saying it was late and they didn't have enough meat to fill all our entrees. That's fine, replace it with a sandwich and move on. An hour later we still didn't have our food. So we called and were told that he didn't know where the driver was and he'd left awhile ago.  Guy calls us back and says another 10 minutes.  An hour and a half later our food arrives cold and missing half the order. Called the store, they were now closed. Didn't answer. Called mystery delivery guy back and he said "yeah they're closed. Go down there and complain in the morning"  Done.

The Sultan market has very good prices for the amount of food you get. I usually get the chicken shawarma  or the fish. I always feel full after I eat there. Everyone is very nice to me when order so thats a plus.  The are quick with the orders and they have a lot of interesting snacks that you can also purchase. You should try it.

I am officially in LOVE!!!  For $3.75 I was stuffed with a super delicious falafel sandwich. I am not an expert at Mediterranean food so I can't name all the ingredients in this small and yet filling pita sandwich. I do know they work amazing together. I added some sriracha sauce to spice it up a bit but the it's good enough as it. The meat combo dinner plate is humongous and such a great value.  They also have a variety of exotic drinks. I tried coconut juice today, didn't like it that much but will definitely try something else the next time I go. There's also a full salad bar at less than $6/lb.  I am totally going to get addicted to this... Knowing how falafel is prepared, I am prepared to hit the gym extra hard for as long as I live in this area. If you haven't tried Sultan's Market, you should!
guy on the register is sexysexy. the falafel isn't so bad either.

I haven't ever eaten in the restaurant, but I've had falafel take out a number of times after work.  I've always been impressed.  The price is right, and it's really good, authentic falafel.  Unfortunately I haven't ventured outside of my falafel zone because it's always so damn good, so I can't speak for the rest.  Service is good, food is good, price is great.  What's not to love? A coworker of mine found a big thick hair in her falafel one time...can't help but think of that every time I take a bite... :(
I happily devoured a Lamb shawerma with a huge bin of hummus for $10. Great find.
Cheap and tasty.  I love the shawerma and hummus.  The chicken shawerma is always flavorful but not overpowering.  The hummus is the best hummus I've ever had, it's very creamy.
Sultan's is a wonderful place for lunch or a casual dinner.  It's a great place to come by yourselve and watch the world go by.  The buffet has a variety of wonderful choices.
Really great Middle Eastern food for the price. I love the cafeteria-style, laid-back feel. The vegetarian stuff is really good. It's BYOB and has outdoor seating. Yay!
I think I could eat here every day. The falafel sandwich is amazing. highly recommend the lentil soup. veg/vegan friendly. great staff. A+
Super tasty, and great prices! Sultans is excellent. I only wish this location was larger with more seating; I work nearby and would come here for lunch way more often if I could dine in!

I'll admit this location is not near is good or have near the selection the North ave. location has, but it's still pretty darn delicious. Who wouldn't want a truckload of delicious flavorful food for like $6?  I can't do lamb, but I love their Chicken Schwerma sandwich with hummus and Jerusalem salad (mostly made of delicious cucumbers). Their salad bar is also awesome! At the other location I had my first sip of Aloe juice. Ummm, yeah, no thanks. I'll stick to keeping Aloe usage in my lotions and for my sunburns.

Placed an order online at 530 on a Friday night and by 5:50.. knock knock !  Falafel was delightful and portions really huge.  Also ordered hummos, zippy bread and a meat pie.  Meat pie is a meal all in itself for $2.

You really can't beat the prices and the food is pretty good as well.   I always go with the falafel pita sandwich which comes with hummus and jerusalem salad and my husband has gotten the kofta sandwich and lamb shwarma, both of which he seemed to really enjoy.  The service is super quick and the place is really clean so if the weather is crummy I'll eat inside, otherwise I'll take it to go and bring it to the park.

Eh.  I think I'm spoiled from Taza in the Loop. I got the kefta kebab sandwich last night...and if there's one thing that kills my food boner, it's when a sandwich falls apart as I'm eating it.  My heart and stomach hurt when I saw bites of my jerusalem salad falling sadly to the table.  The kefta kebab was just too saucy, and when combined with the salad, the pita got completely soggy and started collapsing every time I brought the sandwich to my mouth. And I don't mind getting my hands dirty while eating but I was thoroughly embarrassed to have kefta kebab juices, spicy sauce, and salad liquid running down my hands, arms, and mouth.  I may have killed a small tree with my napkin usage. My boyfriend didn't have any problem with the lamb shawerma sandwich though. Next time I'll order anything but the kefta kebab.  The falafels looked promising... Overall, this was pretty disappointing.

Now this is what I needed. Been in a bit of a funk lately and something was needed to break out of it. Well, this broke it and put a good smile on my face.  I ordered up a meat pie, chicken shwarma sandwich and a lamb shwarma sandwich, along with some hummus and some pieces of falafel. The lamb shwarma stood out and I also asked for it to be spicy which worked great with it. The hummus was very good and I was able to enjoy over a few days. The best thing about here was the price on everything. I was able to get enough food for lunch and dinner along with the hummus lasting about three days for just about $25. It is small inside, so if I had sat down it would've been kinda filled with me and two other people. But, its nice coming across other middle eastern places that aren't just in albany park, especially when they are as affordable as here.

I love this place and eat here as often as possible. Not only is their food some of the best middle eastern food I have, they have a great staff. Their delivery service is amazingly fast, which is great. My favorite story of them: Once, I called in order for delivery and had TERRIBLE bronchitis, had lost my voice, and sounded awful when I thanked the delivery guy. About an hour later, the delivery guy came back. He apologized that he couldn't come back right away, but handed me an extra bowl of chicken soup and said, "it sounds like you could use this." He said that the staff usually try to do something nice like this when a customer sounds sick. I was shocked, but he was halfway back down the stairs before I could thank him or tip him, but he refused anyway. I nearly cried, it was so sweet! Ever since, I tip VERY well every time I go in. They are such good people there!
I am new to the area and this has been my go-to place when I'm hungry and want inexpensive, fresh food fast. Everything I've tried so far I've liked and I also like the guy behind the counter :).

So I came back, years later and tried the Chicken Shawerma Sandwich. For $4.75, you really can't beat it. Their Falafel sandwich is $3.50, ain't too shabby either. The shawerma sandwich was ok. It was incredibly greasy, and dripping from the cucumber salad, which wasn't too bad. It was difficult to eat, but very large which is a plus. I could have eaten it with a fork I s'pose. I got a little bit of artichokes, green beens, and brussel sprouts from the salad bar. My total came to under $7.00 which was awesome. The green beans were a bit greasy, but still good. I'm not warding Sultan's off whatsoever, I will just have to be choosy with my choices...

Not at all what I was craving.  Middle Eastern food usually gives me indigestion because of all the heavy spices that they use on their foods, but this place took it to a new level.  The food was uber-salty and seasoned to death to probably hide the not so good quality underneath.  The prices were great but they should be as it really feels like a fast food place.  A few of my friends and myself included got pretty sick after this place, so I will not be back.  The prices are great, so maybe I just had a bad experience.  Other people swear by this place, but I am not one of them, unfortunately.

same great price, food and service as their wicker park location. always fast no matter how busy it gets along with the food that's fresh. sometimes they run out of stuff but that's a good thing, meaning you know they're not holding onto something a week old. if you dine there near closing, though, the food won't be as fresh and just not as good.  i usually get the meat combo dinner, which is a bargain for all the food you get around $9: rice, hummus, pita, chicken and beef schwarma, beef kobab and salad. i toss in a falafil for good measure, which are excellent. they also have a variety of baked goods, such as desserts, breads, snacks along with juices and sodas. i've only had a few things from their extensive, tasty looking salad bar. so yeah, lots of choices for fresh, fairly priced goodies only drawback is the place is very small, maybe 5 or 6 tables squished together, so it definitely caters to the carry out crowd. in the summer, they have a couple of tables avail for outdoor seating

Yummy yummy yummy!  I ordered their chicken soup (Mama masata I think it's called...) and it was full of delicious flavor.  I also ordered rice with lentils and tabbouleh which were both superb!  The prices are reasonable and they don't scrimp on the portions.  The salad bar also looked delish, think I'll have to come back and make sure it tastes as good as it looks!  Can't wait to eat my leftovers!

Lincoln Park was definitely a top-pick area when I moved to Chicago and I have to admit, proximity to Sultan's Market had a lot to do with it. I LOVE Sultan's Market!!  I really don't see how someone can't...   Cheap, delicious and can serve as 2 meals, easily. Get the meat combo dinner w/ CURRY RICE & tabuli... I'll be honest and tell you that I haven't even tried the other rice that they offer. Every time I go to this place, I always say I will but as we all know, saying and doing are two very different things... Just looking at the curry rice through the glass barrier is irresistible.  Also good, their falafel sandwich and make it spicy!  YUMMMMUMMUM.

It was 10pm on a Friday night and the Korean BBQ restaurant just closed its door on my friend and me.  Quickly glancing a few blocks in both directions, our options seemed to be either this place or a late-night Mexican joint. Upon walking into this restaurant, you'll be sure to take note of the decor including the numerous mirror tiles and ceiling work. A rather small yet enticing setting. The employees behind the counter didn't say a single word when we walked in; they stood behind the counter zombie-like waiting for us to order.  Nevertheless, I ordered the Chicken Shawarma sandwich. Coming as a regular of Pita Inn, I was in for a unique encounter... The sandwich cost me $5.24 but they sure weren't stingy on the toppings.  If you're a hummus lover, you'd love the fact that it was oozing from the sandwich (hummus is not added at Pita Inn).  The sandwich was lukewarm at best and the chicken dense from probably sitting on the burners for a while.  The "Spicy Sauce" is a must-add to enhance the flavoring. This place offers a lot of bang for your buck, but it didn't really make me fall in love.  With many other options in the area, I'll keep this to an after-everything-closes place.
Pretty solid lunch spot. I knocked off 1 star because the chicken soup is not so good (very bland), but everything else here is DELICIOUS! Good service too -

Cheap, fast, convenient food.  Some of the food was very good, all of it was good but not across the board great.  The hummus had a great creamy texture and good flavor, but could have used a little more lemon and garlic.  The falafel had good flavor, but could have been crispier on the outside.  The cucumber salad was very good, but maybe a little runny.  The rice and lentils was very good.  All-in-all, definitely somewhere I would come back for good cheap food.

They feed me a lot.  I am most impressed by the salad bar.  They have all kinds of interesting things to put in your salad that make it not so bad to be eating a salad!  The sandwiches are healthy and filling, but a little lacking on flavor.

People loooooooove Sultan, but not me. As a vegetarian I do end up going to Sultan once a month or so since I really love falafel, hummus, and lentil soup, but the quality of their food always leaves something to be desired, especially after eating at pita inn dozens of time. Their falafel is always dry and bland and their pita is not fresh.  The falafel sandwiches always fall apart due to the extremely thin/watery Jerusalem salad.  The food in the salad bar is bland and cold.  If you show up at the wrong time you can expect to wait in line for quite a while, and they only take cash. That's a lot of negative stuff, but I do keep going back, at least occasionally.  The prices are fantastic; I get a ton of food for $6 or 7.  The food is just good enough that I don't mind eating.  As long as it's not lunch or dinner time the lines aren't too bad and the food is prepared quickly.

I really don't like to be the bad guy here. And I'm not trying to bring anyone down. I just figured some people might care to hear about my experience with this place. And on that note: I was starving, hung over and in desperate need of  some awesome delivery food and decided to try this place out after reading all the great Yelp reviews. Now, perhaps the fact that I grew up in Southeast Michigan, near the city of Dearborn, where REAL Middle Eastern food is abundant and a way of life, has hurt Sultan's Market's chances of ever living up to my high expectations. But, I can honestly say that I wouldn't even feed this food to my cats. I ate this stuff over 30 minutes ago and I still can't get this funky taste out of my mouth :(   The Chicken soup was freezing cold, the pita for the hummus was stiff and bland, and the Lamb Shawerma Sandwich was so gross and soggy, and the meat inside just tasted dirty. Great prices, yes. But considering how disgusted I feel right now, totally not worth it. I completely  wasted $24 plus tip. And I'm still hungry...

Sultans deserves a 5 Star rating for both price & flavor...but to be honest I've been there over 10 times and always gotten the chicken shwarma dinner - how can you beat it for $7! It seriously is enough for 3 meals. So much rice, lentils, and tons of chicken. My favorite in Chicago land thus far!

Fresh hummis and pita is just so much better than anything you can buy at a grocery store, that's why I run down the street to Sultan's.  My favorite snack is super inexpensive and oh so tasty.  But don't forget the sandwhiches: they are great too.  When the weather is nice, it's relaxing to grab a bite and sit outside.

We had two sandwiches: The warm mildly spicy chicken shawarma meat at the bottom of a decent cuke salad and a cold pita & the falafel vegetarian version.  It was a quick lunch.  Sauces and fresh pita/wrap breads are a *big* deal for me with shawarma.  Hence the three stars.  It's a decent sandwich for a very decent price. Not a Petra of a sandwich. If anyone knows of a fresh wrap "doener" like sandwich in Chicago, turnip pickles and all, please..do message me.

Super cheap, super fast, and huge range of delicious foods. You can either get the buffet or oder from scratch. This is probably one of the best places to go if you're starving out of your mind. I think anyone can find something they like at this place. I might be back to give it it's fifth and final star soon!

It was shitty out and we had 2 hours to kill before we were going to see the Black Swan (damn you sold out shows!). We were hungry and we knew that a Sultan's has opened in LP, and since we were huge fans of the first one (and huge fans of their prices) we decided to try it. Ok, this location is like, a fraction of the size of the WP location. However, the food was still great and the service was too, our food was ready like that! /snap I got a falafel sammich and a lentil soup. Soup was good on a cold night, though I think I prefer WP's version of it. The falafel sammich was the identical to the Wicker Park version, which was VERY tasty. I love falafel sammiches. They are filled with spicy sauce, falafel, Jerusalem salad and hummus in a soft pita. They are melt into the floor worthy. SO GOOD.  I was ridiculously full after this dinner so I rolled myself down the street back to the theater, where we watched the Black Swan. Sidenote: Black Swan was awesome. Everyone should see it.

MUST TRY THE BAKED EGG AND CHEESE PIE! It is delicious. Sometimes I have it as is, or sometimes they cut it in half, load it with veggies and hummus and make a sammie outta it. Either way it is the perfect medium between breakfast and lunch. (about $2 for the pie!) I love going here for a quick or late breakfast on the go for my work. Chicken or lamb shawerma or the meat combo dinners are my staples here. (I would recommed the chicken while the lamb isn't incredibly tender and the sausage is dry). But you get sooooo much food I often split the plate and two people can easily get FULL. At $8 a person I am sure this place will survive the economy... better yet nuclear disaster.  Also they have a huge salad bar of which I haven't destroyed yet, but it looks just as delish.  A quick, good mediterranean place is hard to come by and this place nails that objective. It isn't quite 5-star food but it's still good for 5-star prices! A plus... the guys behind the bar are very nice... and handsome. I always get a warm smile when I come in!

This place is really astounding. I was craving Mediterranean food on Sunday (Sundays are now officially Mediterranean food nights for me), and so I turned to Yelp! to figure out where to go. This place is literally around the corner from my apartment, and I pass by it all the time and had never gone in. My roommate mentioned how great it was as well, so I figured I'd give it a shot. Oh. my.  I ordered a falafel sandwich (I ordered it spicy), and it was huge and stuffed full of greatness. I also got 3 grape leaves and some olives from their salad bar ($5.99/lb I believe), and so my entire meal was $5 and some change. I cut the pita in half when I got home, because as I said it was huge. I also made some Greek rice to go with it, which let me save the other half for the next day....two meals for under $6 is totally do-able. The falafel really was great....it wasn't dry, very flavorful, and the toppings they put on the sandwich (tomatoes, onions, Jersualem salad, sauce, hummus) were all perfect. I ordered it spicy, and it was pretty spicy, so I'd suggest trying the medium on your first visit.  The grape leaves are great too... I find that some places have really minty grape leaves, but not here. Perfection. And it's great that you can pick out how many you want and you pay by the weight (which I actually think is cheaper than when you go order 4 for $2.50 at other places).  The second half of my sandwich, and the one grape leaf I saved, the next day were maybe even better than the first time around. Big points for having food that keeps well as leftovers. Apparently the Wicker Park location is cash only, and delivery at this location is also cash only. I don't know about that, but for take out credit cards are accepted and there's no minimum.  I was kinda thrown off when the credit card receipt had a spot for a tip (like at sit down restaurants, and they also have a tip jar), and when I gave it back to him he said "no tip"....that was weird to me. It's pretty much a fast food restaurant, and a serve yourself salad bar. But, all that awkwardness aside, the food was great and I will be back very soon.

The space is tiny and the guys that work there are not as cool as the North Ave Sultan's. Other than that, the food is amazing. I found if you go around 11:30 am, the spinach pies are just out of the oven. De-lish.  I still prefer the North Ave Sultan's but if you're in the area, this place is great for your Middle Eastern food craving.

Sultan's Market has standard Middle Eastern food for really reasonable prices.  All the shwarmas are delicious.  And they come with a decent portion of rice.  I also think the fish entree is pretty spectacular for the price. The salad bar has quite a few things that are worth it.  And you pay by the weight just like in a cafeteria. There are quite a few Middle Eastern delicacies (candies, snack, etc.) if you are into that sort of thing.

I went here yesterday for a quick carryout lunch. Just moved into Lincoln Park and wasn't keen on getting a sandwich from Potbelly's, Einstein's, Panera, etc. Props to Sultan's for 1) the warm pita (!!!), 2) the very eggplant-y baba, and 3) the brazilian cashier!! Middle Eastern food and Brazilians...be still my heart.

Love, Love, LOVE!!  I may be addicted to their falafel sandwiches!! They are tasty, not too salty, moist... basically delicious!  A great place for a fast, cheap dinner.  The service was quick and the employees are friendly. They have a wide variety of fun beverages and snacks near the counter, which I love as well I have gotten takeout each time, but they do have a little seating area inside that probably hold 6 people max.

I was a bit disappointed, based on the reviews. Good Middle Eastern is subtle, while what I had (kefta kebab, rice with lentils) was just bland. The hummus was good, but I've had better in various Albany Park spots.
The best falafel sandwich The lentil soup there is no other one like it Strongly recommend to evryone

Sultan's Market is really tasty and not overly greasy or salty.  I had the chicken shawarma sandwich, which was delicious (and $4.75), had a lot of vegetables on it and was really good without being too salty. Also had falafel and hummus which were also great.  I ordered delivery and the food came very quickly. Just FYI delivery is cash only.

great place to eat. second time eating at sultans. only because i live all the way near ohare. the first time was at their north ave location. ive tried chicken shawerma and the falafel sandwiches in other places near my home but nothing compares to this place.  food is fresh. and cheap! taking advantage that i was in the lincoln park area i went and took 2 of each of my favorite things... recommend it to everyone!

Wanted to try Sultan's Market but also wanted some soup for lunch.  Had the Lentil Soup for $3 (large) - very, very tasty! I took it to go. They packed up a lemon wedge for the soup - great! I also had a falafel ball ($0.50).  This was my first time having falafel.  I loved it! Outside was crispy and browned.   Overall experience: Fast service. Easy to take to-go.  I am full and very satisfied after having a tasty lunch for only $3.86. I'm giving Sultan's 4 stars (for now) until I try the Falafel sandwhich, baba ghanouj, and some other main courses (which I'm sure will be amazing as all the food looked really fresh and smelled amazing) & to test their middle eastern cuisine compared to other restaurants like Noon-o-Kabob and Aladdin's.

I used to hate this place. I thought the food was shitty. The dinners I had were dry and flavorless. It made my stomach hurt. I didn't know what I was missing, I didn't know what the big deal was. Then I had a sandwich. Chicken Shawerma..... 4.75.....INCREDIBLE. It's the exact opposite of everything I had had. Soo good. Melt in your mouth chicken, dripping with flavorful spicy sauce.....yuuuuuum. My stomach doesn't hurt yet, time will tell. if it does...WOOORTH IIITTTT.

Sultans Market Is great! Low prices (~5 dollars for a big falafal or schwerma pita) and the food is delicious.  I almost always get a Chicken Schwerma sandwich with a falafal ball, Extra spicy of course! It is full of delicious meat, Jerusalem salad, tomato, and lots of fresh hummas. This is one of my favorite neighborhood stops!

This place is awesome - low prices and good food = WIN. I got the Chicken Shawerma pita, which was lined with hummus, stuffed with char-grilled chicken, and topped with Jerusalem salad. You can customize it to make it a bit spicier, which can vary from mild to hot.  All for about $5.   They also have chicken shawerma plates, lamb shawerma pitas/plates, and also falafels.
I've gotten a few quick falafels or shwarma from here to go. Great food and speedy service.

Sultan's is the bomb dot com. My brain always says that all falafel is the same, all Jerusalem salad is the same, all lamb shawarma is the same. Then I eat these items at Sultan's and I'm reminded of just how stupid my brain can be sometimes. They take it to the next level. I don't know how they do it, but they do. Respect.

Love the food & service.  Every time I dine in here the Staff is clean, kind, & speedy.  Not to mention the fact that I ordered delivery in the dead of Winter at 10p. at night and the guy rushed over on his bike in a snow storm.  He carried his bike up 3 flights of stairs to bring me my food so I did not have to come down.  He was rewarded with a very large tip :-) The Falafel is just how I like it too.  Yum yum

Looking for a casual and inexpensive place for a tasty meal?  Sultan's Market hits the spot! This location is very small and, on a nice summer night, very busy.  You need to get there before 6pm if you don't want to wait in line for dinner. I tried their lamb shawerma accompanied by basmati rice, jerusalem salad, hummus, and pita bread.  My friend had the same except the meat was chicken.  YUMMMMMMM...  The portions were generous so the two of us only managed to finish a little over half our plates.  We definitely satisfied our craving for Middle Eastern food. I will definitely be back to try the other menu items, but plan on taking it To Go...

"Hi-oh!!" That's what Ed McMahon (RIP) would have said had he eaten at Sultan's. He'd have had to say it back to back: once when they rang up his order and saw the very low total... then again after the first bite of his falafel. Then, if you had asked him, you'll be back, right? He would have certainly said, "You are correct, sir!" That goes double for me. I thought the chicken schwarma was really, really good. You won't go wrong with this, trust me. I'm a sucker for good food at a good price. This place delivers both in spades. Can't wait to hit this place up, again.

After seeing this place showcased on Check Please!, I was actually kind of excited to go there. But alas, I was pretty disappointed. The portions were big and I left stuffed, but not satisfied. The lamb shawarma was very bland. Even the hummus, rice, and cucumbers didn't have a lot of flavor. The falafel was pretty good, I will admit. It's very fairly priced but I guess that comes at the expense of great flavor. Maybe other things on the menu are better.

The meal I had (lamb shwarma) was satisfying, but the flavor was kind of lacking. I found the hummus to also be rather bland and creamy. Needs more spice, more flavor. The redeeming quality? Delicious falafel. I want to come back and try out that falafel sandwich. That sounds good. So I'll give this place another shot with that.

Food-wise, this is expectedly comparable to their North Avenue location:  namely, above-average hummus, below-average baba ghannouj, and a top-notch falafel sandwich.  I wish that the patties were crispier, but overall their falafel sandwich is one of the best around. Interior-wise, this is just a wee spot, barely a hole-in-the-wall with seating for only twelve.  So don't assume that you will be able to get a seat, especially on a weekend around lunchtime.  But they do seem to turn over quickly and you will never wait too long in line either.  They do squeeze a small salad bar into the space, so you should find everything here that you would at the other Sultan's.  Except maybe fewer hipsters.

i ordered delivery from this place tonight after reading all of the great reviews and i'm happy to report that they didn't disappoint! I got the chicken shwarma (sp?) platter and the Falafel platter. Both AMAZING!!!!  Everything is tasty - the hummus, the jerusalem salad, the pita, the lentil rice... the ONLY thing that i wish they had was garlic sauce.  I'm used to lebanese and armenian places having the most amazing garlic sauce but they dont serve it.  :( I'll definitely be eating here frequently.  YUM!

The food here is amazing but this location sucks in comparison to the Wicker Park/Bucktown location.   The few times I've eaten in here, the workers were somewhat rude.  Also, this one seems to skimp on portions in comparison to the other.  My chicken schwermas from the other location are always packed full of meat, hummus, and salad.  The one my boyfriend brought me home from this location last night was less than half full and there was so little hummus, I could barely taste it. I'm just glad that I live closer to the Wicker/Bucktown location.

This is my go to Falafel place. The hummus is smooth and has just enough garlic and lemon.  The sandwich is topped with Jerusalem salad which adds a really great fresh element.   On a  side note, I don't understand how something as simple as their spinach sandwich can be SO good and its really cheap too.

I hit up this salad bar about once a week and love it. Moving away from the standard carrot, beet, onion accoutrement, I really don't even know what half the crap on this table is, but it's damn good. I think I'm going to go there tonight. I would deduct half a star for this creepy dude that somehow is ALWAYS in there when I go, but whatever.

This place is the shit! Awesome food, large portions, at a reasonable price.  I have order a few things but always go back to the Chicken Shawarma Dinner; comes with rice, hummus, Tabul (sp) salad, and a couple of pitas.  It is easily enough for multiple people or meals!   I am telling you, this place has it going!  ENJOY! Oh... On a side note, they do sell some groceries there as well.. not sure what it all is but I am definitely going to take advantage!~

Awesome and cheap little nook on North Clark St, I only wish there was a Sultan's downtown.  Came on a Saturday at noon and was surprised to find hardly any wait - this location offers a quick take-out/to-go counter and pay-by-the-pound salad bar, and 5-6 little tables to sit down and eat.   Couldn't decide what I wanted to try most from the lengthy menu but ended up getting: - lentil soup:  creamy and on the thinner side - falafel:  perfectly crunchy with the ingenious use of panko, ordered with a side of hummus - Zatter bread: heavy on olive oil and a thick paste of sesame seed, thyme, sumac, and oregano. Oddly the salad bar also had kimchi.  Others had the lamb schawerma and falafel pita, all of which I will be back to try.  Menu prices are very cheap and easy to grab a meal for ~$8. This is Middle Eastern good eats as it should be - tasty, fresh, and cheap.

Dear Sultans Market,  You've ruined my life. After moving away from the city I can no longer eat falafels. I have tried, but only then to long for your spicy, Jerusalem saladie, homemade hummus laden pita pocketie perfection. I hate you but yet I love you. One day we will meet again, till then I will always have the memories. P.S. The only con about this place is the seating. Lot's of people love this place which leaves you standing around going, ummm where do I eat this?

please let the owner see this. ... two stars. because the food is good. and i've been eating there since they were a little corner store in wicker park.  my hang-up (no pun intended here) is the customer service. specifically, the man on the line taking phone orders.  before i go on, i have to say ... no issue with the delivery itself the delivery guys are a great face to the restaurant and almost always friendly and reallllly prompt.  so ... every single time i call, i feel like i'm interrupting whoever is on the other end of the line. every time. this most recent time, i called and made my order. fine. didn't have a list of drinks so i asked if he could name some iced teas. he said they don't have any right now. what? really. it's comin' on summer and ... no iced tea. that just didn't seem right. whatever. at least i know for sure they have grapefruit soda so i took one of those and a ginger beer.  otherwise a simple order. spinach pie, rice and lentils and a large taboule salad. i asked if the taboule salad came with pita (otherwise i would've ordered a side of pita). man on the line says "yes. comes with pita." cool.  until the order arrives. taboule, lentil soup (not rice and lentils), spinach pie, drinks and no pita.  so i call and let them know the error. the man on the line seems not really to know what to say. new on the job maybe? whatever the case. i would please like pita and my rice and lentils. "oh. ok. that's going to be about 30 min" fine. so i also tack on some pita for the rice and lentils since it's not included.  10 min later i get a call and the man on the line says, "um ... the rice and lentils, we're going to have to charge you for the pita." fine. charge me for the bread after messing up my order and making me wait even longer to eat.  ok. story coming to a close now. rice and lentils arrive with one order of pita bread. was this the pita that was supposed to come with or the ordered or paid for?  whatever.  i'm done.  moral of the story. if you can get past the man on the line, they have tasty products. otherwise, double reconfirm your order even if they don't. peace.
Come on just go! Have a falafel and like it....I know everyone I take to this place loves it!!

I stopped in Sultan's Market, got a falafel sandwich, sat down, and took a bite. It was so good I literally shit my pants. Literally in the literal sense. So I waddled bow-legged up the street to McDonalds, stuffing delicious falafel in my mouth, and cleaned up in the bathroom.  Sultan's Market: Pants-Shittingly Good.

Sultans Market is one of my favorite Middle Eastern Restaurants.  They have FANTASTIC chicken shawarma and in my opinion, the best falafel in the city.  The hummus is also very good.  You can get all of that with rice for just $7.50.  Definitely worth the money and I go here so often I cannot even count.

Really good stuff especially when you are on the go. One of the highlights was the spinach pie. It had just arrived while we were there. My son loved it! Yeah!!! We had the lamb sandwich, chicken sandwich, salad bar, falafels and three drinks for $26. Not bad at all! The spinach pie we bought after when they brought them in....

The word of the day is"duh."  My first visit to Sultan's most options looked appetizing; but I chose the #5 Hummus Appetizer and as the guy prepared it I found myself drawn to the salad bar with its olives, veggies, and leaf wrapped. . . something-or-others. I shyly pointed, "Can I get salad bar, too?" The cutie replied, "No, that's for display purposes only." Ha, good-looking, efficient, and sarcastic. Already, I like this place. Well, I grabbed some treats from the salad bar and when I paid, I couldn't resist adding a piece of baklava. I lost a brave battle to take my meal home and I murdered that shizz in record speed, leaving no evidence but a smile on my face indicating I relished those seconds spent.  I know I sound gross- but why the s do I work out so much? For a random pig out session that any red-blooded person going to Sultan's would indulge in! The Hummus is good, less flavored or beany than some places, pita bread fresh and toasty, salad bar olives and grape wrapped cheesy thing dope, and baklava flaky and sweet. I've been a few times since and the tastes, uber low prices, and location (close to Urban Outfitters, Lincoln Park, and Lincoln Park Zoo) render it almost criminally attractive. I saw they set up little tables on the sidewalk. Nice. If you haven't been go. . . "DUH!" You'll like it, we all deserve something easy, savory, or sweet in life; a generalization as plain as my crude exclamation which brought you this silly post. And if you agree or utter the word of the review, imagine Pee Wee Playhouse sirens/excitement in your yummy reality of the experience. Then thank me later.

GREAT Food and GREAT prices! I've been to this place way too many times considering I just moved here 6 months ago. Their shawerma sandwiches are unbeatable (try the lamb, spicy) and their various other items are outstanding (meat pies, egg & cheese pie, etc). Probably the best food for your money in Lincoln Park!
Everything I've tried is amazing, and the prices are cheap. Definitely not known for the ambiance, but the food is delicious! I would highly recommend Sultan's to anyone, and I often do.

Delicious, filling, inexpensive.  Really, you couldn't ask for much more. I have had issues with going later and having them be out of what I wanted, but the alternatives are always just as yummy.  Also they let you sample stuff if you're not sure. The staff is always nice and I've never left disappointed.

It's like they put crack in the food or something. I get cravings for food from this place and can't think of anything else until I'm satisfied. Love, love, love their chicken shawerma sandwiches. A super soft pita filled with chicken that is spiced-just-right, heavenly hummus, jerusalem salad, tomatoes, and onions.  Go for spicy - it's not really that spicy. They also have delicious baklava that melts in your mouth. The dinners are also a really good deal for all the food that you get.

Just moved around the neighborhood and thought I would give it a try. Got the meat combo dinner and it was pretty good. It came with 3 types of meats, one chicken and two types of lamb.The side rice and pita were delicious as well. Good value for the amount of food.

No need to say much - some of the best falafel you will find in Chicago. Also, some of the worst parking you will find in Chicago. I recommend the falafel. I have done other items (shwarma included) and been disappointed, but the falafel always rains supreme.  Go spicy or go home when they ask what sauce you want. After you order, head over to the salad bar to get some extra yogurt sauce, free of charge.  If you are like me, for a mere 50 cents (or $1, they tend to be fickle), you can add feta cheese as well! This is not your run of the mill feta cheese. Its huge chucks swimming in a pool of feta au jus. Glorious. Limited seating so I recommend you dont eat in - that limits my chances of doing so, and in the end, its all about me.   One point of contention - I asked the man at the counter if I should get a baklava and his quote was "well its a lot of calories and summer is around the corner". Insert eating disorder now.
Awesome falafel...great price, fast delivery!  What more can you ask for??  Give it a try, you'll like it!
Sound of a Perfect lunch. 1 Chicken Shawarma and can you make that spicy, please!

This place is a pretty solid kebab and falafel place. The falafel is probably a little more solid than the kebab, as I noted when I just ate the meat by itself. With the pita and hummus, it's fine, but the meat doesn't seem to be really the best quality, as observed if you were ever to try to eat a low-carb meal here.  So for the meat dishes I guess it gets 3 stars, maybe 3.5 for the falafel. But the (seemingly) fresh baklava they have here is amazing. And it gets 5 stars. It's currently in the running for best baklava ever, along with Aladdin's

So, what makes Sultan's Market such a great experience?   Tasty, crispy falafel, a wide variety of fresh ingredients to top the tasty, crispy falafel, and having the aforementioned tasty, crispy falafel in fresh pita, and then wrapped up neatly for easy eating.  The salad bar alongside, was loaded with, cheese, stuffed grape leaves and olives...  Definitely a place to stop in for a light bite that gives you big satisfaction.

Every Monday night after I finish a grueling training session with the best personal trainer this side of the Mississippi, I watch Gossip Girl with some friends that live across the street from Sultans.  So OF COURSE we get falafel sandwiches to munch on while we watch Dan, Blair, Serena and the crew backstab each other on TV.  It's my one indulgent meal of the week.  Some people like pizza.  Some like ice cream.  I like falafel. And you know what?  EVERY Monday I'm happy.  Because my falafel is excellent.  It's crunchy.  It's moist.  It has awesome hummus, cucumber and tomato salad and red onion on it.  And it fills my belly full for about $5. Seriously.  This place is the best.

Oh MAN this place is delicious. Surprisingly enough, I have never tried falafel despite the fact that I love Middle Eastern food, live in New York and am kind of old. For like 3.50 you get this ginormously huge, stuffed pita overflowing with goodness. It was delicious... I got mine spicy and let me tell ya.... yum. Cheapest meal in the 'hood, is what I say.

Sultan's Market has one of the most well-stocked, fresh and delicious salad bars I have ever come across. It is also remarkably cheaper than crappier salad bars. Far crappier. What am I talking about? Want a baked hot pepper stuffed with bulghur wheat and spices? Have one. Shredded beets? Help yourself.  Fresh pita chips? Steamed French beans tossed in garlic? Dried tomatoes soaked in olive oil & herbs? Capers? Kalamata olives? Sultanas? Whole artichokes dressed in garlic and parsley?  I won't go on. You have already drooled on your keyboard.  Would you like a pita with zaatar to go with that salad? They have that too. Insanely friendly people will weigh your purchase and take your money. I was shocked again- What does he mean it is under a pound? I *tried* to put too much in the tray! See you very soon, Sultan's Market. This is the beginning of a long and deeply satisfying relationship.

The food is quick and the service is good.  I recommend the falafel sandwich and trying a mix of sauces.  Its a great price for the amount of food you get.  The chicken and lamb shawerma are more of my regular menu items.  I had the spinach pie and it was a bit doughy for me,  I prefer a flakey crust.  I am starting to become a regular because I live close and its a quick grub-grab.  If you're in doubt, give it a shot.

Their falafel sandwich is very good. It is fast, inexpensive and hits the spot when you are in the mood for Middle Eastern goodness.  I also tried their babaganoush... it is pretty heavy and loaded with garlic. You have been warned. The best part is their pita bread. It is oh SO soft and delicious.  I just admitted to eating carbs. Bad girl!

This was my first time trying middle eastern food, and I was pleasantly surprised I liked most of what they had to offer.  I got the meat combo platter so I could sample all the different types, with curry rice, hummus, and pita bread.  The different meats were tasty, and the curry rice had nice spicy kick, but not burning.  The hummus was pretty tasty and I'm not a big fan of hummus.  The pita bread was really soft and nice.  I'd go back again.

This is totally good falafel. Nothing to write home about, but cheap and satisfying. My sandwiches there tend to fall apart, which isn't a problem I've had at other falafel places. I usually end up using a fork, which is just fine. The falafel is really good and crunchy, I just wish everything tasted like... more. The lentil soup IS really good, though the few times I've gotten the bread with zatar it's been pretty dry. The salad bar is great and so is the lamb schwarma. Though it's not my favorite falafel in the city, it's a definite stop on my post-farmers market walk home during the summer.

Big fan of sultans market, and just tried this location for the first time.  I usually am visiting the Wicker Park Location as it was always closer to home.  This is more of an express location, they have a few seats to sit and enjoy but mostly your going to have to get it to go. Same menu, salad bar... plus this location excepts credit cards!!!  I will say that everything tended to taste the same except the guy who made my falafel ended up building it differently than I have ever had it done.  He also was not very fast. (In wicker park your almost rushed to place your order... it's that busy) I had kind of expected the same service, but none the less it turned out to be a great experience and filled yet another void in my life!   Three cheers to the egg pie and the four cheers for the dolma!

I feel cheated that I lived in Lincoln Park for several years and didn't know about this spot.  Perhaps if I would have strayed away from Demon Dogs more often, I would have ran across it.  Sultan's market is probably one of the cheapest and most delicious little spots within that general area of Lincoln Park. The chicken Shawerma I had was absolutely delightful.  I love the multiple chili-sauce options.  It was loaded with delicious chicken, pickled vegetables and sauce.  The hummus was interesting...not my favorite, but I liked it's rustic and grainy texture.  The salad bar was very beautiful...an insane array of pickled vegetables and likes...at $5.99 a pound, a pretty damn good deal.

So I was walking to my car from Molly's with some cupcakes in hand, and then I spotted Sultan's Market across the street from where I parked. I already had dinner, but I've heard about this place so I crossed the street to look at the menu. I love chicken shawarma, so I decided to buy one for lunch the next day.  The place is tiny, but they had a nice salad bar off to the side. It looks like a place you would order takeout from, or have a quick bite if there are seats available. Walked in and was quickly greeted with a "hello." I ordered the chicken shawarma to go, and the guy made it right in front of me. The service was fast and friendly, and I was in and out in 3 minutes.  I got in my car, and was ready to head home. I decided to give the shawarma a quick nibble before I left. Needless to say, a nibble turned into a bite, and a bite turned into...let's just say the shawarma didn't make it. I ate the whole damn thing before I could even start my car. Did I feel like a gluttonous sloth? Yes. Was it tasty? Absolutely!  Sultan's Market, you had me at "Hello."

Cheap, fast, fresh and good; I think some people eat there almost every day judging from some of the conversations I overheard.  They had two vertical spits, one for chicken shawerma, one for lamb (yay).  The menu includes soups, savory pies, salads, falafel, shawerma plates. * Lamb shawerma wrap ($5.75): You can specify mild, medium or spicy.  The shaved lamb pieces were chewy and had good flavor but some pieces were a bit gristly.  The pita was soft and thick, but cold.  They added tomatoes, raw red onions, generous amounts of creamy hummus and a Jerusalem salad (chopped cucumbers in tahini with parsley).  I'm not used to having that much cucumber salad in a shawerma wrap - it's unusual but I liked the crunchy freshness it added.  The hot sauce was fairly spicy.  I've had better meat and better pita but the price is right and the flavors are tasty.   The salad bar is huge - looked interesting.  Though it's called a market, they don't sell that many grocery items.  They sell some Middle Eastern mixes, olive oil, and candy.   Seating is limited.  Delivery available.

Why can't there be a location in the burbs??  Sure we have pita inn in the chi-burbs, but this place is a great alternative with lots of vegan options, like SPINACH PIE!!  I ordered the falafel sandwich and a spinach pie - both vegan. They were fresh, tasty and filled me up the right amount. The falafel @ Sultan's is hands-down better than Pita Inn -- they were big, fresh and had a lot more flavor, but the portions @ pita inn are way larger!  BTW, I walked away only spending 6 bucks and some change. Can't beat that.  My friend's roommate ordered the veggie combo plate, and it was pretty slim pickings. At pita inn you get hummus and baba, but you had to choose between the two @ sultan's.  If you're a vegan in the burbs, you have to make the trek down to sultan's @ some point. It's just too damn good to miss out on.  The salad bar seemed good. They had a fair amount of veggies, some grape leaves, and other delectable items, but I would shoot for something off the menu.  Especially for the vegans out there, it's imperative you get a falafel sandwich and either the zatter bread or spinach pie!

falafel sandwich. huge falafels, so tasty, so delicious. MMMMMMMMM. i ate mine for 2 meals b/c it was so big! definitely won't disappoint. although, i think baba pita remains my go-to place b/c they have great daily specials and delivery!

Oh Sultan's, how I miss you.  I lived a block away, and I came here ALL THE TIME.  I mean I was as regular as you can be.  The food is stellar, I think I pretty much lived off their chicken shawarma with extra hot sauce.  The food is cheap, I mean $6 will fill you up.  The staff is very friendly.  The place is tiny, so if you can get it to go, do so.  But it's a wonderful joint and I miss it dearly.

I've wanted to like this place since it's around the corner from me, the reviews are great, and I have been searching for a good fast-food middle eastern place in the area.  I've been to the Wicker Park location and this one a few times each.  It's the same - it fills my belly for a good price, but it's never ... delicious-ness.  The place is super clean, has a fresh looking salad bar, and the staff are friendly.  But all of the items I have tried - hummus, spinach pie, falafel, chicken and lamb shawarma, and jerusalam salad - just are not hitting the spot for me.  I much prefer Pita Inn in Wheeling, Olive Mountain in Evanston or Pita House in Schaumburg.

This place is great for its price! A falafel sandwich for $3.75 is hard to beat, the food is amazing and the people nice. They deliver which is always convenience and the service is very quick. Great for a quick, delicious eat especially for vegans and vegetarians.  Try the lentil soup!
This place is AWESOME. They need to get a drink machine, or at least some water up front, but it's still five stars for taste and value.

I was hungry. It was one of those days where I was working in a Lincoln Park cafe, I was in the zone and I forgot to eat lunch and it was nearing 7pm. So my friend suggested I stop by Sultan's Market on the way home because it's inexpensive and quality. I stopped at Sultan's market on the way to the 22 stop. The place is pretty small, only a few tables. I decided on the Chicken Schwerma to go. It held up pretty well on my way home. Maybe I was just hungry, but I scarfed it down in a hurry and it was delicious. The hummus was pretty good, too. Keeping in mind this was pretty much Middle Eastern fast food, I thought it was actually better than some of the sit-down places I've been to.

I think I could quite possibly be obsessed with this place. I have never had a falafel, and was being very indecisive with my choice. I asked the person behind me as I let them skip me and they said go with the falafel.  I have probably tried them now at about 4-5 other restaurants and I keep thinking of the one I got there. Quick service... Its set up "picadilly" style so it takes them 2 seconds to throw it together.  I was really surprised that the place was BYOB. Apparently, we don't do that down south. So, I will have to go back with some friends and a bottle of something fun and a sprite. The people that work there are nice too and its really inexpensive... Exactly what I was looking for!

Walked in and asked the man at the register, "What do you recommend?". He suggested I start with Chicken Schwarma so I had the dinner plate with the cucumber salad thingy,humus, pita and delicious rice. I felt the Chicken was well seasoned and the sweet cucumber salad balanced the plate nicely. For the price($7 for dinner plate), I felt it was a tasty and affordable meal. I will definitely go back there again. I'll take Leah J's word on the Lamb not a big Glutton of Mutton myself..
